data.what_is:
Postman is the world's leading API platform, used by more than 30 million developers and 500,000 organizations worldwide for building and managing APIs. 

Postman enables teams to efficiently collaborate at every stage of the API lifecycle while prioritizing quality, performance, and security.
data.product_description: Postman enables teams to efficiently collaborate at every stage of the API lifecycle while prioritizing quality, performance, and security.

pricing_plans.plan_description: For individuals or a small team of 3 or less to start testing APIs.
Basic API collaboration for a single team.
plan_features: Everything in the Postman Free plan

pricing_plans.plan_description: API collaboration for larger teams, cross-org, and external partners.
Org-wide API development with advanced support, security, and control.
plan_features: Everything in the Postman Professional plan

initial_reviews.review_title: Sharing my experience of using Postman for more than one and a half year
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Having utilized Postman for over a year and a half as a backend developer, I can attest to its indispensable role in my backend development journey.

Postman has been a support for me in backend development. Its intuitive interface made it easy for me to dive in, even as a beginner. I find myself using it frequently for everything from basic API testing to advanced tasks like WebSocket and gRPC integration. Postman's simplicity and reliability make it my go-to tool every day, whether I'm working solo or collaborating with teammates.

One more thing is you're capable of creating environmental variable in collection scope and global scope. So, no need to changing values on multiple places.

What do you dislike about Postman?
While it was easy to use, but there is a downside that the documentation is not user friendly for begginer. In the beginning when I had to read the documentation regarding Mock test, it was somehow difficult to understand what the writer wants to say. I had to take the help of available blogs on other sites.
Please update the documentation and make it simple.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
The main problem it solved it you can test the APIs smoothly with a better UI interface, and can create and share the collection with teammates easily.

initial_reviews.review_title: Best Tool for API testing
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I have used Postman for API testing for my Java project. It is very helpful for backend API testing, also there are multiple ways in which we can send and receive our data from the API.

What do you dislike about Postman?
It is GUI intensive and it has limited offline functionality.
Apart from this, the documentation of the errors that occurred should be properly written.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Suppose you are a Full Stack Developer or someone who is working on the backend, You are working on a project that has some API's and you want to test whether the dataset received from the API is correct or not, The Postman tool will help you a lot, apart from this, If you have integrated Security to your Website or Backend It Also allows you to pass the tokens and the params necessary for your API.

initial_reviews.review_title: API Testing Made Simple and Efficient
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
A user-friendly interface that simplifies testing APIs efficiently. Clean UI, easy to use which makes the life of testing APIs easy.

What do you dislike about Postman?
There is a learning curve, initially, when I started using Postman I found myself looking into the documentation more than what I could think of. Also, I get too many notifications, which I don't like.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman has solved so many problems that I used to face before adopting.

Like, for the API testing, I used to use command line tools like curl and wget. Now with Postman, with its simple interface, I can easily send requests, get responses, and make sure that everything is working fine.
Easily switching between different environments and having variables support which can be used in request headers etc., are life-saving. Being a Python backend developer, who builds the APIs too frequently, Postman makes my life easier.

Also, documenting APIs was a painful task for me, but now with Postman, I'm able to generate documentation easily.

review_question_answers.answer: There is a learning curve, initially, when I started using Postman I found myself looking into the documentation more than what I could think of. Also, I get too many notifications, which I don't like.

Easily switching between different environments and having variables support which can be used in request headers etc., are life-saving. Being a Python backend developer, who builds the APIs too frequently, Postman makes my life easier.

initial_reviews.review_title: PostMan - Review
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I primarily use PostMan as a means to test internal systems via REST API Calls

What do you dislike about Postman?
I dont like that I now am required to create a log in to fully use the product, but I do see the benefits of it.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Although there are other tools availble for the work I do (ie SOAPUi). PostMan is free for use. It does require a user login to fully utilize the tool and it's feature like Collections and Environments. The nice feature with the login for PostMan is that your "loaded" API Collections follow you where you are logged in. As a trainer I work locally for some projects and on others (the majority of the time) , I am using a Virtual Machine. All I have to do is open PostMan and log in and everything is "loaded" and ready for use.

initial_reviews.review_title: The one and only option for api securty testing
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
There are lots of tools for api testing, but none of them provide integration for proxy and more collaboration-based functions, like the ability to export all collections to JSON and import other collections. They have really good user-friendly interfaces, and the best thing I feel is pre-request scripts. Pre-request scripts are really helpful for me as a pentester.

What do you dislike about Postman?
When we try to import a large collection, most of the time it will crash if you have low specs.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Shearing API endpoints,knowledge and requests from the development team to the security team will be kind of hard if post-man doesn't exist. and getting the requests in burpsutes( a testing application) will never happen without  postman proxy.

initial_reviews.review_title: Fastest way to test API endpoints
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Easily organize many APIs and their endpoints, the ability to use placeholders and set environments, automatic prettifying JSON (input). Good support for different types of authentication, very clean UI, just works very efficiently.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Rendering large JSON responses can get a bit slow, no numbering of JSON items in a list when collapsing (no easy way to see e.g. number of items in response).

Sharing with team members is a paid feature.

The editor to add documentation is limited.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Ability to quickly test API endpoints with different settings & environments.
Document how to use APIs and individual endpoints.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Postman?
review_question_answers.answer: Easily organize many APIs and their endpoints, the ability to use placeholders and set environments, automatic prettifying JSON (input). Good support for different types of authentication, very clean UI, just works very efficiently.

initial_reviews.review_title: Lightweight API client to create different API requests
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a very simplified tool to execute API requests and their different operations like GET, PUT and POST. It is very easy to install and also learn, even for a new user. We use it almost thrice a week to execute different REST and SOAP APIs using JSON and XML request formats, and then validate the responses.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Now, Postman has made its services chargeable, with licenses, if you want to save the existing requests in workspaces. So, that is one issue. Other than that, rest everything is fine.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman is a very good tool to accomplish API request and response validations. Moreover, this also helps in testing API automation, with tools like Selenium to verify if the API endpoint is returning correct values or not. Instead of worrying about the slow load of front-end applications, it is easier to just validate the backend services of APIs using Postman, hence that saves a lot of time and effort.

initial_reviews.review_title: Best Tool For API Building & Testing
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Easy Navigation and Team Feature.
Testing and building api's.
Open Source
I use postman daily for my development purpose. Its very easy to navigate and colab with my teams as well. I daily use postman and test my api.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Sometime my api response is not showing as per the data I have send.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman is addressing key challenges in API development by providing a centralized platform for building, testing, and managing APIs. It streamlines the entire API development lifecycle, allowing for easier collaboration among team members and ensuring the delivery of high-quality APIs. Personally, Postman benefits me by simplifying the testing process, facilitating collaboration with team members, and providing a user-friendly interface for API development. It enhances efficiency, reduces development time, and helps ensure the reliability of the APIs I work with.

all_reviews.review_title: Sharing my experience of using Postman for more than one and a half year
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Having utilized Postman for over a year and a half as a backend developer, I can attest to its indispensable role in my backend development journey.

Postman has been a support for me in backend development. Its intuitive interface made it easy for me to dive in, even as a beginner. I find myself using it frequently for everything from basic API testing to advanced tasks like WebSocket and gRPC integration. Postman's simplicity and reliability make it my go-to tool every day, whether I'm working solo or collaborating with teammates.

One more thing is you're capable of creating environmental variable in collection scope and global scope. So, no need to changing values on multiple places.

What do you dislike about Postman?
While it was easy to use, but there is a downside that the documentation is not user friendly for begginer. In the beginning when I had to read the documentation regarding Mock test, it was somehow difficult to understand what the writer wants to say. I had to take the help of available blogs on other sites.
Please update the documentation and make it simple.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
The main problem it solved it you can test the APIs smoothly with a better UI interface, and can create and share the collection with teammates easily.

all_reviews.review_title: API Testing Made Simple and Efficient
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
A user-friendly interface that simplifies testing APIs efficiently. Clean UI, easy to use which makes the life of testing APIs easy.

What do you dislike about Postman?
There is a learning curve, initially, when I started using Postman I found myself looking into the documentation more than what I could think of. Also, I get too many notifications, which I don't like.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman has solved so many problems that I used to face before adopting.

Like, for the API testing, I used to use command line tools like curl and wget. Now with Postman, with its simple interface, I can easily send requests, get responses, and make sure that everything is working fine.
Easily switching between different environments and having variables support which can be used in request headers etc., are life-saving. Being a Python backend developer, who builds the APIs too frequently, Postman makes my life easier.

Also, documenting APIs was a painful task for me, but now with Postman, I'm able to generate documentation easily.

all_reviews.review_title: PostMan - Review
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I primarily use PostMan as a means to test internal systems via REST API Calls

What do you dislike about Postman?
I dont like that I now am required to create a log in to fully use the product, but I do see the benefits of it.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Although there are other tools availble for the work I do (ie SOAPUi). PostMan is free for use. It does require a user login to fully utilize the tool and it's feature like Collections and Environments. The nice feature with the login for PostMan is that your "loaded" API Collections follow you where you are logged in. As a trainer I work locally for some projects and on others (the majority of the time) , I am using a Virtual Machine. All I have to do is open PostMan and log in and everything is "loaded" and ready for use.

all_reviews.review_title: The one and only option for api securty testing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
There are lots of tools for api testing, but none of them provide integration for proxy and more collaboration-based functions, like the ability to export all collections to JSON and import other collections. They have really good user-friendly interfaces, and the best thing I feel is pre-request scripts. Pre-request scripts are really helpful for me as a pentester.

What do you dislike about Postman?
When we try to import a large collection, most of the time it will crash if you have low specs.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Shearing API endpoints,knowledge and requests from the development team to the security team will be kind of hard if post-man doesn't exist. and getting the requests in burpsutes( a testing application) will never happen without  postman proxy.

all_reviews.review_title: Fastest way to test API endpoints
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Easily organize many APIs and their endpoints, the ability to use placeholders and set environments, automatic prettifying JSON (input). Good support for different types of authentication, very clean UI, just works very efficiently.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Rendering large JSON responses can get a bit slow, no numbering of JSON items in a list when collapsing (no easy way to see e.g. number of items in response).

Sharing with team members is a paid feature.

The editor to add documentation is limited.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Ability to quickly test API endpoints with different settings & environments.
Document how to use APIs and individual endpoints.

all_reviews.review_title: Lightweight API client to create different API requests
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a very simplified tool to execute API requests and their different operations like GET, PUT and POST. It is very easy to install and also learn, even for a new user. We use it almost thrice a week to execute different REST and SOAP APIs using JSON and XML request formats, and then validate the responses.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Now, Postman has made its services chargeable, with licenses, if you want to save the existing requests in workspaces. So, that is one issue. Other than that, rest everything is fine.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman is a very good tool to accomplish API request and response validations. Moreover, this also helps in testing API automation, with tools like Selenium to verify if the API endpoint is returning correct values or not. Instead of worrying about the slow load of front-end applications, it is easier to just validate the backend services of APIs using Postman, hence that saves a lot of time and effort.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman: Your Essential Tool for Testing APIs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a widely used API development tool that enables developers to design, test, and document APIs. Its features include automated testing for bug detection, an intuitive interface for creating and executing requests, and the ability to organize requests into collections for efficient management and sharing.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Postman presents a user-friendly interface, yet beginners may find its learning curve challenging. Users have encountered occasional performance issues with the desktop version, notably with large collections or complex requests, causing slow response times and memory concerns.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman's solutions streamline the API development process, improve collaboration and communication among team members, and ensure the reliability and performance of APIs. These benefits ultimately lead to faster development cycles, higher-quality APIs, and better user experiences for developers and end-users alike.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent Tool for API Testing and Collaboration
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
What I like best about Postman is:

User-Friendly Interface: Postman's user interface is exceptionally user-friendly. It makes it easy for me to create, manage, and run API tests without a steep learning curve. This intuitiveness significantly reduces the time it takes to get started and be productive.

Robust Testing Capabilities: Postman provides a comprehensive suite of testing tools. I appreciate the ability to create detailed test cases, run automated tests, and validate API responses with ease. It's a time-saver and ensures the reliability of our APIs.

Team Collaboration: Collaboration is seamless with Postman. The ability to share collections, collaborate on API development, and leave comments on requests fosters effective teamwork. This feature has improved communication within our development team.

Documentation Generation: The ability to generate API documentation from our collections is a standout feature. It helps us maintain well-documented APIs that are accessible to both technical and non-technical team members, making it easier to understand and use our APIs.

Integration Options: Postman integrates seamlessly with our other development tools, such as Jira and GitHub. This integration streamlines our workflow and helps us manage and track API-related tasks more efficiently.

Overall, what I like best about Postman is its combination of user-friendliness, powerful testing capabilities, collaborative features, documentation generation, and integration options. It has become an essential tool in our development process, making API testing and development much smoother and more efficient.

What do you dislike about Postman?
When discussing what you dislike about Postman in a review or discussion, it's essential to provide constructive feedback. Here's a template for your response:

What I dislike about Postman is:

Learning Curve for Advanced Features: While Postman is generally user-friendly, I've found that some of the more advanced features can be challenging to master. It would be beneficial if there were more accessible resources or tutorials to help users unlock the full potential of these features.

Cost for Pro and Enterprise Plans: The pricing for the Pro and Enterprise plans can be a bit high, especially for smaller teams or individual developers. While the features they offer are valuable, it may be a barrier for some users. More flexible pricing options or a more affordable tier for small teams would be appreciated.

Performance Issues: Occasionally, I've experienced performance issues when working with very large collections or running extensive test suites. It would be great to see improvements in the platform's performance and resource optimization to handle larger workloads more smoothly.

Limited Offline Mode: Postman primarily relies on an internet connection, which can be a limitation when working in environments with unreliable or restricted internet access. An improved offline mode or the ability to cache collections for offline use would be a valuable addition.

Documentation Updates: While Postman does offer documentation, it could benefit from more frequent updates to keep pace with new features and changes in the tool. This would help users stay informed and make the most of Postman's capabilities.

In summary, my dislikes about Postman revolve around the learning curve for advanced features, the pricing structure for Pro and Enterprise plans, occasional performance issues, limited offline functionality, and the need for more up-to-date documentation. These are areas where I believe Postman could make improvements to enhance the user experience further.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman is solving several key problems for me as a backend developer, and these solutions greatly benefit my workflow and collaboration with the frontend team:

Streamlining API Development: Postman simplifies the process of API development by providing a user-friendly interface to design and test APIs. This streamlining of development tasks saves me time and effort, allowing me to focus on creating robust APIs.

Effective Communication: Postman acts as a communication bridge between backend and frontend teams. It allows me to share API endpoints, request examples, and documentation in a structured and organized manner. This ensures that both teams are on the same page and reduces the chances of miscommunication.

Real-World Testing: Postman enables me to perform real-world testing of APIs by simulating various scenarios, including error and success responses. This ensures that the APIs are thoroughly tested and ready for integration into frontend applications, reducing the likelihood of unexpected issues.

Collaborative Feedback: Postman's collaboration features facilitate seamless feedback and collaboration with the frontend team. They can provide comments, suggestions, and insights directly within Postman, leading to faster issue resolution and improved API quality.

Documentation Creation: Postman's ability to generate API documentation is a significant benefit. It allows me to create comprehensive documentation that serves as a reference for the frontend team. This documentation improves the usability of the APIs and reduces the need for constant clarification.

In summary, Postman solves problems related to API development, communication, testing, collaboration, and documentation. These solutions benefit me by making API development more efficient, ensuring effective communication, enhancing testing capabilities, enabling collaborative feedback, and providing comprehensive documentation, ultimately leading to smoother backend-frontend integration.

all_reviews.review_title: Making the process of API handling easy
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman's publicly available workspace I like so much. It becomes easy to see all APIs of a product. When using Twitter API, documentation was tight, but Postman made it easy. I could see all available APIs at a glance & you don't need to do the setup to get a taste of it. Just paste your credential & the actual response is in your hand.

What do you dislike about Postman?
It's not that easy tool; you need proper training for it or to go through tutorials they provide; otherwise, it is good for development & testing.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
While working on a task where you need to write backend API first, Postman is much more helpful. You don't need to set up frontend or build to test your APIs. You can try it too quickly.  Setting up a front-end app in my daily job is quite cumbersome; it usually takes longer. So when there is a bug, I just hit APIs to my server from Postman, which significantly saves my time.

all_reviews.review_title: Streamlining API Development and Testing for Efficient Workflow
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is an exceptional tool that offers a multitude of features for API development and testing. One of the standout qualities of Postman is its user-friendly interface, which makes it accessible to both beginners and experienced developers. The intuitive design allows for easy navigation and quick adoption of its powerful capabilities.

One of the best features of Postman is its ability to send and receive HTTP requests effortlessly. The robust request builder and comprehensive options enable me to create and customize requests with ease, including various HTTP methods, headers, query parameters, and request bodies. It simplifies the process of interacting with APIs and ensures accurate testing and development.

Postman's collection and environment management are invaluable for organizing and maintaining APIs. Collections allow me to group related requests, making it convenient to execute multiple requests simultaneously or sequentially. Environments provide a way to store variables, making it effortless to switch between different configurations and test various scenarios without manual modifications.

Another significant advantage of Postman is its powerful testing capabilities. With the ability to write tests using JavaScript-based syntax, I can easily automate the verification of responses, ensuring that my APIs function as expected. The extensive logging and debugging tools within Postman make it a breeze to troubleshoot and identify any issues during the development process.

Additionally, Postman boasts an extensive marketplace of pre-built integrations and plugins, allowing for easy integration with third-party services, test automation frameworks, and other developer tools. This extensibility enhances productivity and extends the functionality of the tool to suit specific project requirements.

What do you dislike about Postman?
While Postman offers a rich set of features, there are a few areas that could be improved. One aspect that can be challenging at times is the learning curve associated with more advanced features and functionalities. Although the tool provides comprehensive documentation and a helpful community, some features, such as writing complex tests or utilizing advanced authentication mechanisms, may require additional learning and experimentation.
Another area that can be improved is the performance of Postman when working with large collections or executing numerous requests. Occasionally, there can be slight delays or lag when dealing with complex API scenarios, but it's worth noting that this mostly occurs in resource-intensive operations and does not significantly impact the overall experience.

Lastly, while Postman offers a free version with robust functionality, some advanced features, such as team collaboration and more extensive reporting, are only available in the paid plans. While understandable from a business perspective, it might limit access to those features for individuals or small teams with budget constraints.

Overall, Postman is an exceptional tool for API development and testing, providing a user-friendly interface, powerful request-building capabilities, and extensive testing features. Despite a slight learning curve for advanced features, occasional performance considerations, and limitations in the free version, Postman remains an indispensable tool for developers and testers alike, streamlining workflows and ensuring efficient API development and testing processes.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman solves several problems in API development and testing, and its benefits are significant for developers. Here are some key problems that Postman addresses and how it benefits me:

Streamlining API Testing: Postman simplifies the process of testing APIs by providing a user-friendly interface and powerful testing capabilities. It allows me to create and send HTTP requests with ease, customize headers, query parameters, and request bodies effortlessly. The ability to automate the testing process using JavaScript-based syntax helps ensure the correctness and reliability of APIs. Postman's comprehensive logging and debugging tools further aid in identifying and resolving issues during testing, saving valuable time and effort.

Simplified API Documentation: Documenting APIs accurately and comprehensively can be a challenge. Postman solves this problem by generating interactive documentation directly from the requests and responses created during testing. The documentation is automatically updated when changes are made to the API, ensuring that it remains up to date. This feature simplifies the process of sharing API documentation with stakeholders, making it easier for them to understand and consume the API.

Efficient Collaboration: Collaboration is essential in API development, especially when working in teams. Postman provides features for sharing collections, environments, and documentation, allowing team members to collaborate seamlessly. With the ability to import and export collections, multiple developers can work on the same API simultaneously and share their work effortlessly. This streamlines the development process, encourages collaboration, and ensures consistency across the team.

Test Automation and Continuous Integration: Postman integrates well with continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) pipelines. It allows for the creation of test suites that can be run automatically during the build and deployment process. By integrating Postman into the CI/CD workflow, I can catch API issues early, ensure that changes to the API don't break existing functionality, and maintain the quality and reliability of the API over time.

Extensibility and Integration: Postman offers an extensive marketplace of integrations and plugins, providing the ability to extend its functionality and integrate with other tools and services. This allows me to enhance my workflow by integrating Postman with tools like source control systems, test automation frameworks, and monitoring services. These integrations make it easier to incorporate Postman into existing development processes and leverage additional features and capabilities.

By addressing these problems, Postman significantly benefits me as a developer. It saves time and effort in testing and documenting APIs, facilitates collaboration among team members, enables test automation in CI/CD pipelines, and provides the flexibility to integrate with other tools. Overall, Postman enhances efficiency, improves the quality of APIs, and streamlines the entire API development and testing workflow.

all_reviews.review_title: Efficient API Development and Testing Made Easy with Postman
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
One of Postman's distinguishing qualities is its user-friendly design, which makes it incredibly simple to use and navigate. The application's clean, user-friendly style welcomes you immediately and makes it simple to develop, maintain, and test APIs. Postman's UI's ease of use and effectiveness substantially increase productivity and speed up the API development process, whether you're a novice or a seasoned developer. You can rapidly access and edit various request types, headers, parameters, and authentication methods thanks to the clearly labelled tabs and simple menus, ensuring that you may efficiently interact with APIs in a controlled and structured way. Postman is an effective tool for team collaboration and smooth integration because it also provides an extensive library of pre-built connections.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Although Postman has many valuable features, a few things may be improved. The sporadic slowness or latency when navigating complicated API procedures or handling massive datasets is one element that some users find annoying. The performance of Postman may be impacted while handling multiple requests or large amounts of data, resulting in slower response times and sporadic delays. This may be especially apparent when conducting extensive API simulations or testing. A minor nuisance that may restrict possibilities for users who wish to continue with the accessible version of Postman is that several sophisticated features and functions are only accessible in the commercial edition of the software. Furthermore, although the user interface is typically user-friendly, new users could find the learning curve challenging.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman is an invaluable tool that effectively addresses various API development and testing challenges, ultimately benefiting developers in numerous ways. One of the critical problems it solves is the time-consuming and manual nature of API testing. Previously, developers had to rely on custom code or multiple tools to test APIs, leading to a cumbersome and error-prone process. However, Postman revolutionised this process by providing a centralised platform for creating and executing automated tests. This significantly reduces the time and effort required for testing, enabling developers to identify bugs and issues early in the development cycle and ensuring a more reliable and efficient testing process.

Collaboration and communication among team members are also significantly improved with Postman. Its built-in collaboration features allow developers to easily share APIs, test cases, and documentation with their colleagues. Real-time collaboration, comments on specific API requests, and the ability to share collections streamline teamwork and enhance overall project efficiency. By facilitating seamless collaboration, Postman helps teams work together more effectively, saving time and reducing misunderstandings.

Furthermore, Postman simplifies API documentation, another common challenge for developers. With its intuitive interface and tools, developers can effortlessly generate comprehensive and up-to-date documentation for their APIs. This documentation includes request examples, response schemas, and usage guidelines, ensuring that APIs are well-documented and facilitating better understanding and adoption by other developers or external consumers. This saves valuable time and ensures that APIs are appropriately documented, enhancing overall API usability and reducing support and maintenance efforts.

In summary, Postman solves the problems of manual testing, collaboration hurdles, and documentation challenges, delivering numerous benefits to developers. By automating testing processes, facilitating collaboration, and simplifying documentation, Postman saves time, improves productivity, enhances team collaboration, and ensures the reliability and effectiveness of APIs. With its comprehensive features and user-friendly interface, Postman has become an indispensable tool for developers, empowering them to streamline their API development and testing workflows.

all_reviews.review_title: Decent for API Testing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
1. Firstly, it has a basic and user-friendly interface; it takes very less time for a new user to get used to it.
2. It has a great API request manager, which can allow us to separate different types of requests in different groups.

What do you dislike about Postman?
1. It has a limited feature for WebSocket requests.
2. Easy to get started but hard to master.
3. Recently, I faced an issue in the app where I get errors such as being unable to load the workspace in Windows 10 and the saved APIs not showing in the app.
4. Also, sometimes, the official website of Postman also shows server errors.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
1. I mainly use this app for API development, API management and API testing.
2. Tasks such as displaying the response, Testing the API errors, like how the API is handling the errors.
3. API management, such as grouping different APIs and saving body and header data to use the same in the future.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman review
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The user-friendly interface of Postman sets it apart from other similar tools. Its intuitive design and well-organized layout make it easy to navigate and understand, even for those new to API development. The ability to create and manage requests, organize them into collections, and visualize responses in a structured manner significantly enhances the development workflow.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The abundance of features and options can be intimidating, and it may take some time to fully grasp and utilize all the functionalities effectively. This can result in a steep learning curve for beginners, potentially leading to frustration or confusion.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman simplifies the testing and debugging of APIs. With its intuitive interface, developers can easily create requests, define parameters, and examine responses in a structured manner. The ability to save and organize these requests into collections allows for efficient testing of multiple API endpoints, ensuring their functionality and compatibility with various scenarios.

You can share collections, environments, and documentation with team members, enabling seamless collaboration during API development and testing.

Postman can sometimes experience performance issues when working with large collections or environments. As the number of requests, scripts, and variables increases, the application's performance decreases, leading to slower response times and occasional lag.

all_reviews.review_title: The Pros and Cons of Postman
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman offers a clean and intuitive user interface that makes it easy for developers to interact with APIs. It provides a visually appealing environment for designing, testing, and documenting APIs.
Postman offers a robust testing framework that allows developers to create and automate comprehensive tests for APIs. It provides features like assertions, variable management, and test result reporting, enabling efficient testing and debugging.

What do you dislike about Postman?
While Postman has a user-friendly interface, it can still have a learning curve for beginners new to API development and testing. The various features and functionalities may take some time to master, especially for those with limited programming experience.
Postman's performance can sometimes be affected when working with extensive API collections or complex requests. Response times may increase, and the application may become less responsive, impacting the overall user experience.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
The team creates test scripts in Postman to automate the testing process. They can easily set up assertions, handle variables, and manage test data. Postman's interface provides a clear overview of test results and makes it easier to identify and fix issues, improving the efficiency and accuracy of testing.

all_reviews.review_title: The best API testing software
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Its very easy to get started with API testing on Postman. Its intuitive, user friendly and power packed. It is easy to test out the APIs in a compreshensive manner using Postman since it has support for all types of HTTP methods and various different input types are supported and the response is also handled very well and is easy to understand the errors in case of some error as it specifies the proper status code and details regarding the code causing error.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Postman is a great tool but is not ideal for all scenarios. It is not very good with SOAP APIs and also we need to keep changing the script for different scenarios. Also, if we do not need the advanced features and only need simple API testing, we are better off with an extension in VS Code which is simpler for normal REST API testing.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman is making API testing easier. With postman, we can test out backend APIs thoroughly before we link them with the frontend. It is quick and easy to test and we are able to catch errors in APIs at this stage. It helps in faster prototyping.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman : Efficient tool for API Testing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is an incredibly powerful tool for working with APIs, providing a comprehensive set of features and functionalities. As a technical analyst, I have found Postman to be an invaluable asset in my work tools.

One of the standout features of Postman is its simplicity when it comes to making API calls. The user interface is intuitive, making it easy to construct and send requests to APIs. With just a few clicks, I can specify the endpoint, set headers, add query parameters, and include request bodies. This streamlined process saves me valuable time and allows me to focus on other aspects of my development tasks.

Another aspect that I appreciate about Postman is its wide range of authentication options. Whether I need to use Basic Auth, OAuth, SAML, or Bearer Token, Postman provides the necessary tools to handle various authentication methods effortlessly. This flexibility is crucial when working with different APIs that may have different authentication requirements. It ensures that I can test and interact with APIs regardless of their authentication protocols.

Collaboration is another area where Postman excels. The ability to share collections of APIs with team members and work on them collaboratively is a game-changer. Multiple users can access and make modifications to the same set of APIs, allowing for efficient teamwork and coordination. This feature promotes collaboration and simplifies the process of managing and maintaining API collections in a team environment

What do you dislike about Postman?
Firstly, the interface can sometimes be overwhelming, especially for newcomers. There are many options and settings that can be configured, and it can be challenging to find the specific settings you need. Simplifying and organizing the interface would greatly enhance the user experience, particularly for beginners.

Additionally, working with variables in Postman can be somewhat challenging. While variables are a powerful feature for dynamic and reusable requests, their implementation in Postman could be more user-friendly. The process of saving data from response in variables is not always intuitive, and it can take some trial and error to get them working correctly. Improving the usability of variables would make them more accessible and increase their usefulness.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman solves several problems that greatly benefit developers and API testers. Firstly, it provides a fast and efficient way to test APIs. With Postman, developers can easily construct and send API requests, including headers, parameters, and request bodies. This eliminates the need for manually writing code or using complex tools for testing APIs, saving time and effort.

Additionally, Postman offers a wide range of pre-developed tools and features specifically designed to work with APIs. These tools include the ability to handle different authentication methods, generate code snippets in multiple programming languages, and run automated tests on API endpoints. By providing these ready-to-use features, Postman simplifies the process of working with APIs and reduces the need for developers to build custom solutions from scratch.

all_reviews.review_title: A must have tool on every Web Developer's machine
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman allows you to quickly test API endpoints with complete control over all parameters of the API call. It provides a quick way to tweak API variables to fine-tune the call and extensively test the endpoint.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Nothing as such comes to my mind. But if I had to nitpick, I would say that the UI might seem cluttered to newcomers. A cleaner, simplified UI mode would be great, especially for those who are only getting used to the application.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
It is not easy to test APIs in the browser. Postman is a dedicated tool for just that purpose and provides all the tools to quickly and effectively test and optimize APIs and UI components that use these APIs.

all_reviews.review_title: Using Postman almost every day
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Very useful to test API end-points in a very intuitive user interface. Also very easy to automate the chainning of API call sequences with scripting to input data from one API call to another.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The fact that Postman now runs in the cloud could worry some that their data is being snooped on, but we are only using it against TEST environments (not PRODUCTION), so not an actual worry for us.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
It allows us to test our API end-points in an easy way. It also allows us to conduct proof of concept (PoC) when integrating with a 3rd party vendor, before building a full blown integration.

all_reviews.review_title: API testing with postman is simple
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
We can create a workspace for the whole team to collaborate and test the APIs. Switching between environments (local, dev, stage, prod) within the same collection without duplicating is a good feature. Automatically fetching auth tokens from token generating script is good.

What do you dislike about Postman?
It would be good if postman could automatically load new bearer tokens whenever the existing permit is expired. Do we need the capability to run postman collections through Jenkins or any CI?CD pipelines easily without much configuration or using Newman.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman is helping in testing the APIs during development and after deployments. As a person from a non-technical background, it's pretty simple to operate postman and validate functionalities during Business Acceptance Testing.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman - An amazing API tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
-One of the best tools I've ever used for testing all the APIs built by the team.
-It helps me create API requests, import and export the existing collections (to share them with others easily) and saves a lot of time.
-The option of creating a global and local variable and allowing these variables limited access is another fantastic feature.
-The ability to establish different workflows is another feature I like the most. This tool will assist us in keeping our work organized if we are working on multiple projects at once.
-Another feature that greatly assisted me in remembering which APIs I had used in earlier days is History Tracking.

What do you dislike about Postman?
-Postman has several licensed features we can only access if we pay for them. If those functionalities were made available to the general public, I believe people would stop looking for alternative tools.
-Another thing I dislike about Postman is that the software server occasionally goes down during business hours and takes many hours to recover. But this issue occurs once a quarter.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
-Earlier, it was somewhat challenging to execute APIs in order, but Postman has fixed that issue by giving us a choice to run APIs in order. We can create a collection and then arrange our APIs in the order we want them to run.
-I work on APIs daily, I develop APIs, and then I need to create a workflow to check if the APIs are working as per my expectations. I use Postman daily to perform Unit testing and to run some edge cases. Hence, it benefits me by saving time and making my Unit testing more efficient.

all_reviews.review_title: The must have tool for a developer
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
-Easy to install and simple to use.
-Available for all major operating systems.
-Variety of options available to save and share API collections.
-Large community support.
-Inbuilt JSON beautifier.

What do you dislike about Postman?
-With the increased number of open tabs, it's very hard to identify the correct tab in need therefore, it will be really helpful if it will allow us to do some kind of logical grouping.
-It won't allow us to run API's in parallel, everything is just sequential.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
As backend developers, we need to test a lot of API's in different environments. With Postman, we don't need multiple endpoints for the same as we can easily switch between different environments. Also, it has options to create sharable workspaces, where we can easily share an adequate number of collections with each other and increase productivity.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman great UI testing utility for REST APIs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The ease of use of the user interface. Postman also automatically fills in some expected conditions of the traditional cURL statement making it much quicker to test your APIs without spending too much time writing the same things over and over again.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Sometimes Postman will make assumptions about an API call and automatically generate some headers that aren't expected by the receiving party. As a result, I will sometimes have to manually edit/remove some of these assumed headers.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman lets me quickly design and test my API calls before implementing them into the codebase that we're working on. This takes a lot of guesswork out of the process and speeds up production.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman User Experience
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The account is free to use; Any developer can easily afford the application, create the profile and start working on the new collection and request. Even there is an option to import the JSON. We can easily share the JSON with others, which holds all Collections and Requests with all headers and body filled in. So for me, it's an excellent option to work with; since I am primarily working on APIs, This application is more beneficial for me. Everyone in my Organisation is more aware of hitting the API through this application; It is also one reason I'm feeling better about using it.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Sometimes the headers saved in a request disappears and come back. It seems to be some syncing issue with our profile. If that were rectified, the app would be better. Providing Authorization parameters in the collection sometimes goes wrong. Suppose we are giving the token for a Collection and using the same authorisation param to be inherited for all the requests. Sometimes it's not taking correctly, and I am entering the authorisation header separately for the individual requests within the collection. The login process can also be developed within the Postman application rather than redirecting to the Website.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's very much helpful in hitting the services Locally. Passing Parameters is much easier with the input formats available, and even the excel format can be downloaded in the form of bytecode as a response. Since all the Collections store our Account Profile, we can sync it anytime on other devices, whichever we log in to, even after many days.

What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is very easy to use. I had never used it before I started this job and now use it every day. It is very easy to setup and navigate as well as create collections and recall previously used queries.

What do you dislike about Postman?
When using predefined parameters and endpoints, it is sometimes hard to tell which environment you are trying to connect to. So when trying to pull information I will get an authentication issue. This is an issue on me, but having it more pronounced in the UI would help prevent this.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman allows us to quickly test and confirm that APIs are working properly. As an integrator, I can quickly send test files to or get files from a variety of endpoints with ease.

all_reviews.review_title: The most versatile and powerful tool when working with APIs.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
We use this tool at several different stages within the SDLC. Very easy to re-use APIs built by the development team, these can be passed to QA department where the tester can utilize it as a base to perform different functional and performance tests. Once these stages are passed and API is in production, we leverage the previously built API to facilitate the creation of a Synthetic Monitor.

It allows us to send different requests to our APIs and get the response in the format we wish to send and receive. It's very smooth, and collections are very useful for maintaining all the requests.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The only cons that I see are it would have been great if we had the option to export all our collections as one so that they can be shared with our peers and other teams if they require it.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
With the help of Postman, I can hit my Web APIs without using my application independently. If we have a request body, we can quickly call the API and debug it very smoothly, reducing time consumption caused by running the whole application which has to call the API.

all_reviews.review_title: Posting web API request with postman made everything easier
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
My preferred API testing tool is Postman. You can accomplish practically everything with it right now, and it is simple to use. Thanks to it, I can simultaneously design, test, and work with API endpoints. The best feature of the postman, which I adore, is its capacity to interact with as many client interfaces as possible and its ability to support 13-15 different HTTP requests. I must admit that this product is very remarkable and appropriate for both large- and small-scale businesses.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The only thing about postman that I don't like is that it frequently crashes in the middle of my work due to its excessive memory and CPU utilisation.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I can establish a team, share all the APIs with the other team members, and share the responses from the APIs I have accessed in either my private or group space.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman review
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The all in one solution for server side testing. Have been using Postman since a decade. Best tool for testing API's . It allows to have individual as well as team shared workspace, it helps when working within a tool. It has the option to have collections to sort  and save all our requests withing a structured way.
The runner option helps a lot in creating prequisite data for automation and for testing performance.
It makes easier for us to test all realted API's bunched in a collection whenever there are any chnages done to a feature/particular part of the software.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Honestly I have nothing to dislike as we use it on daily basis for testing API's. Reusability is an issue when it comes to scripting, but since we mostly use it for server side calls its an efficient tool for us.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use postman to test the new API request, existing API's that could have been affected due to any changes. Sorting the managing the requests in a collection actually helps to run and validate the API's pre production and even after production deployment.

What is was originally designed for it does well.  Allowing development teams to share API collections.

What do you dislike about Postman?
All things it has attempted to add on that were not part of the original design are better handled by other tooling.  A UI based test framework with no ability to trace code across files, or even use different file types, no support for an IDE, and doesn't use Git for source control is not practical at scale.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
If collections are well maintained, it can provide a good source of documentation for how an API works.

all_reviews.review_title: Both tech and business teams alike can use this super easy API Software
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
As a business owner, I can query and request information from the database directly from Postman App without having the necessity to install the codebase or database setup on my local machine. This helps me run quick checks without having to consume my developer team's time

What do you dislike about Postman?
I can't think of any. Maybe the initial onboarding experience and the learning curve for business users can be further simplified. I was not very successful in persuading my marketing team to use the app to extract quick data

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Quick and seamless access to JSON data. Easy to keep the code modular and help multiple teams access the systems without posing security risks. Both tech teams and business teams in our organization use Postman very effectively and has saved us many man-hours.

all_reviews.review_title: Horrendous customer support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
It's a good way to send API requests and for automated testing.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Their customer support is completely lacking. We purchased a license under the wrong name and hoped to get it transitioned to the proper company name, but they were unhelpful, repeatedly stating that a year-long subscription can't be canceled. This was a subscription I purchased that same day, so it seems incredibly short-sighted not to allow us to transition the license to the proper name.

Use them if you must but look elsewhere if you need any support.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automated API testing

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
when I started my career as a back-end engineer  I was using online API testing websites like extendclass.com and then I began using postman I was stunned at how easy it was to use and how user-friendly it was. It honestly saved a lot of my time while testing APIs.

all_reviews.review_title: Great app for API testing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is the best app for APIs testing, giving all the features necessary for testing the APIs. Postman also offers some extra features, like exporting collections of APIs, which is nice since you can share the collection with your team.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Postman deprecated the postman google chrome extension, which was very useful when switching systems since entering google accounts synced the extensions. I have to install the Postman app entirely if it's a new system.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman gives the platform for you to test your Application Programming Interface (API) and also gives support for passing bearer token so you don't need to depend on web UI for authentication.

all_reviews.review_title: Best platform for API testing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The best thing about Postman
1. The interactive UI of the Postman makes it very easy to use. Even the dark mode theme is fantastic.
2. It saves the history of all the APIs fetched. So the previously used APIs can be accessed easily.
3. We can add query parameters and authorisation directly to the APIs.
4. It Makes APIs integration very easy.
5 It supports all methods like GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc

What do you dislike about Postman?
Nothing Much to dislike, but sometimes the platform lags in fetching the API and only shows the data after more attempts. Also, the platform can be improved for SOAP APIs.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
-The best thing about the Postman platform is that it has a free version which is the best thing for students.
-It helps the testing of REST APIs with all the possible parameters.
-It helps integrate the APIs as we can see all the data.
-It helps in making APIs documentations.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use, simple yet very powerful
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
We currently use postman to test the hundreds of APIs we have with our ERP (PLEX). We have found postman to be a crucial part of our analysis prior to developing an application since it allows us to review input/outputs for HTTP Calls

What do you dislike about Postman?
Basically, for the use we have with this application, I cannot recall anything I dislike about it. It is so easy to use and allows for cloud sync so that you can work on the go; Postman will save your collections, APIs, Environments, etc.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman is solving for us API testing before developing an application; this is especially helpful in figuring out the resources needed to create projects that need to function as RESTful web applications.

all_reviews.review_title: All in one REST API Solution
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Don't look anywhere else if you need an All In One solution for your APIs. You can create separate workspaces, and generate various kinds of reports.  It allows you to create a logical grouping of APIs in a collection to share with anyone and create different testing environments to test your APIs. You can even create Mock Servers, and Various Flows using a different combination of APIs.  It is extremely easy to design, test and share your APIs

What do you dislike about Postman?
Maybe a direct import between swagger and postman would be a nice addition. Otherwise, it is your best friend for any kind of APIs.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our team developed and tested hundreds of different APIs using Postman, It helped us a lot before we start UI implementation or even when backend is not ready we can use this tool just to test API and ensure it aligns with all REST principles and our own governance model.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I like it's API documentation generation feature. The documentation looks very clean and we don't have to write the documentation ourselves. It is so easy when you have to provide the documentation to your co-workers.

What do you dislike about Postman?
It is a little heavy software. I use it's app on my Ubuntu and sometimes the app crashes when I open some code editors and too many terminal windows at once.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use it to create the collection of my App's APIs to provide them to the frontend developers. And also for the documentation generation of my APIs.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful tool to evaluate and tests our scenarios and speed up developments
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I really like the option to save my collections and navigate public collections to speed up any development and learn from mapped services. It's also great for the feature for variables, it's a fantastic way to test among different sandboxes.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I don't really have it, but sometimes I get lost between my public and private collections and where I am editing. But I guess this only happens because usually I only had contact with this tool during the early stages of the project to validate some API usage and logic.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman is accelerating the learning curve of new API integrations like okta, Microsoft, and Autodesk. With several collections of APIs mapped and Variables, it's easy to test and validate customers' scenarios before spending some time implementing them.

all_reviews.review_title: Great for debugging, bad for documentation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a very light weight tool for debugging or testing. It has both web and desktop version. It's interface is a no brainer, pretty straight forward. Saving collections are easy and sharing to other developer is pretty easy too. Easy to write automation testing scripts.

What do you dislike about Postman?
What I don't like is documentation. There is no way that I can generate API documentation like a pdf or word based off my collections. I need to use other tools to do that. That's like a double work. It would be nice to have a feature to generate documentation, which is very useful for third party integration.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Testing my API's and writing automated test cases. Easy to install and easy to share my tests to another developer or QA team. It is playing a key role in our software development process.

Saving collections are easy and sharing to other developer is pretty easy too. Easy to write automation testing scripts.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Testing my API's and writing automated test cases. Easy to install and easy to share my tests to another developer or QA team. It is playing a key role in our software development process.

all_reviews.review_title: Best software for API testing and automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
For me the best thing about Postman is the capability to generate code for API requests in different programming languages like Python requests, cURL etc.
Also, Postman UI makes it extremely easy to implement the business logic very comfortably.
Even the ability to import and export collections is just a boon for us developers.

What do you dislike about Postman?
1. Postman is great for RESTful APIs but not well designed for SOAP APIs.
2. It could have been better if we could use it like a wrapper code just like Flasgger package have for SwaggerUI in python.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
For me Postman is heavily used in testing Flask REST APIs. We have to build several APIs on daily basis and Postman has been really helpful in testing them out before deploying it in production. Even after deploying it we again have a round of tests that happen either through cURL requests or Postman

all_reviews.review_title: First GO TO" thing  for Application interface communication
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
It's a first choice for API testing,as it made tester life easier.
It helps them to test API (almost supports all HTTP method) with various response codes and able to write the functional test suite by creating a simple template.
People can document the api data in collection and share team by creating workspace
People can access the saved documents anywhere anytime by logging into their account in postman app or postman browser extension.
It's compatible for Mac OS, windows and linux
In the Agile methodology world, api testing becomes smooth due to this postman.
We can import the api data by file,curl ,HTML XML, json, CSV,postman collection in various formats.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Even though it has lot of features for API testing, not suited one for SOAP API
It's not compatible for reuse the predefined scripts for new usecase. We need to create testscripts everytime.we can get test results only through html ,json.So we are not able to use for test execution analysis. It's not supports cross platform like webui and mobile.
It's applicable only for API testing

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
It majorly helps to test the rest api with various success codes and responses.
In Agile methodology, we need to test the whole product step by step once it developed
So it helps testing team to write test scripts for all created API

all_reviews.review_title: Postman: The software that helps developer a lot to test APIs.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman has a very simple-to-use UI that can be understood by any average developer and helps. Any API can be called from it quickly, and the URL changing from live to local can be changed very easily.

Separate folders can be created for different projects, making them user-friendly.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Sometimes it fails to add the postman collection we are trying to add.
For example, the postman is not capable of handling global variables. Therefore, when we create new windows, we must copy them while making the environment.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
As developers, when the backend developer creates API before implementing them, postman helps us to run the API in them first so we can set the Response accordingly and make a proper API call and fetch all data.

What do you dislike about Postman?
There is nothing to dislike, but sometimes when I close the postman the data and API URLs which I've tested will be deleted or removed so next time when I need to test then I've to add those API URLs again.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
I highly recommend to developers who are working on the backend side and want to work in this field in future to use postman for all types of testing.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I wish I had known about the Postman app during my college days. Before using Postman when I was working on writing APIs I had to look for the response by putting debug statements and using breakpoints in VS code. But when I started using Postman I found the following benefits,
- Hit any API and see the response directly in 'Response body canvas'.
- The API response is available in four types. They are 'Pretty', 'Raw', 'Preview', 'Visualize'. You can also switch response text to 'Json', 'XML', 'HTML', 'Text', 'Auto'.
- It provides the ability to add query params in the API request and also put authorization info if required to access the API.
- You can create a workspace and connect to it to save/share your API list. Through cURL it's easy to share the API with colleagues.
- The app is available to free users so no need to worry about paying before using or any limited trial version. Though you can pay to get more advanced features.
- Saves history of APIs used in past so it becomes easy to find recent APIs in use.

What do you dislike about Postman?
To be honest, I didn't find any flaws while using Postman. The only reason I'm using this app is that I want to see the response from API and it does serve my purpose. However, if they can add a download button for response things will become handier to use.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am using Postman to see API responses from different services I'm working on. It works in almost all the services which support APIs and query params. It is really fast and saves my API list in the workspace, hence it removes the bottleneck I was facing earlier when I was doing the same via VS code and seeing a response in the browser.

Postman is one of the best platforms to design, and test thoroughly the APIs that you will come across. It has a large stack of open APIs to perform the required R&D as per our requirements.

What do you dislike about Postman?
There aren't many things to dislike when it comes to Postman as it serves the purpose. Code reusability can be introduced in Postman when automating RESTful web services which can be found in certain other API testing tools.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have majorly used Postman to test out the APIs exposed to us during our projects and what they yield during the same before implementing them in a real-time environment or production-based scenarios. all_reviews.review_title: If you love API development/Testing, this is your tool!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is very intuitive for users. The UI is simple and straightforward. I've used it to debug my web services/API endpoints in many projects and have been able to accomplish so much work in little time when Postman is added to my workflow.

What do you dislike about Postman?
There are no downsides that stand out, it's a simple product that gets the job done! The only room for improvement would be expanding their learning centre more to include other areas such as automation.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Before Postman, we either used curl in the terminal or the browser to test endpoints. Not only can you test both local and deployed endpoints in postman, but the UI allows you to format the output to make it more readable and this makes the process of understanding the response better. It also has syntax detection which can be a pain in development.

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool for API testing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
* It is incredibly simple and interactive to use Postman. The dark theme is also excellent.
* It records the history of each API that was queried. So it is simple to access the APIs that were previously used.
* Directly to the APIs, we may add query parameters and authorization.
* Additionally offered are networking approaches that you can utilize either publicly or privately.

What do you dislike about Postman?
* Sometimes, when you paste your API connection, it says, "No data found," but after attempting two or three times, data appears.
* It is necessary to add the commonly asked questions or the live support staff.
* Beginners find it difficult to understand since an API can sometimes become convoluted.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
* It is distinctive in the areas of API testing and UI rendering.
* When we use GET data, the results appear instantly, and backend data is simple to obtain.
* Additionally, you may verify whether your API Link is active or not, among many other things.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman review pros and cons
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
This is a wonderful tool for doing or testing API requests; it's crucial when you're developing or simply want to test without having to deal with cumbersome settings.

What do you dislike about Postman?
If you want to set a content type to JSON, you must first choose "raw"; otherwise, "JSON" will not be an option. At first, it seemed confusing.
We are not able to see console while executing api.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
For sending api requests like post, put, patch, and get, it works well.
Additionally, it has the ability to save answer data, which can be used by subsequent or other APIs.
End-to-end testing is made simple by it.
At runtime, we can produce random data.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman is an Effortless and Efficient tool for building and testing APIs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Made very simple and easy to develop and test APIs. The team workplace feature is great, helps different developers to work simultaneously. Exporting APIs in JSON format helps us to share and use postman collection on different devices. Covers every request and generates curls. Helpful in saving examples of the API which is useful when different people are working on the same project.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The user interface can be made simple for new users. The desktop version takes some to load after the device boot-up. Autosave feature should be added as sometimes if we forget to save the request important data like params and header can be lost.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
As a backend developer, creating and testing APIs for mobile apps and websites is made very effortless using postman. Sharing postman collection with other developers is a great feature, saving examples and generating curl requests makes it efficient to work together. You can work in different workplaces simultaneously which is the best feature.

all_reviews.review_title: Simplest free test tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The possibility to generate automatic test cases from swagger/open API JSON documents. Set up pre/post scripts with JS to programmatically set up vars to use in your test cases.

What do you dislike about Postman?
We try to use Postman to execute load tests but we find it's not very powerful as JMeter or other tools.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Developing fast and simple API test cases for our dev teams solves the problems of passing information from analysts to devs. When we need to study external API services, often with poor documentation, Postman is a very good companion to explore them in deep.
