all_reviews.review_title: Best API testing tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
This app is very useful for API testing, it makes API testing very simple and interesting. It saves our testing data and documents on the cloud so we can share our work with anyone. It provides a feature to use global variables that we can use anywhere in our testing tab. It also allows making a collection of many types of APIs and downloading and import of collections from the system. It covers all types of requests GET, POST, PUT, DELETE etc. It also supports javascript for testing.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The interface is very confusing and complex for beginners, we need good practice to use this tool. The previous interface was very good, now it is very complex. It requires high-power hardware and more resources to run properly. It supports only RESTFUL APIs. All the other things works fine.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have made APIs using json-sever, nodejs and tested them using Postman. I have made some web-based projects which require APIs so that APIs I have tested then used in my projects. I didn't find any other project which can compare with this tool.

It has become much easier to work with URLs using postman instead of doing tedious tasks via command line.

all_reviews.review_title: Review
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The process of developing and testing APIs has been made extremely simple. The team workspace feature is fantastic because it allows multiple developers to work on the same project at the same time. We can share and use Postman collection across multiple devices by exporting APIs to JSON. Curls are generated for each and every request. It comes in handy when multiple people are working on the same project and need to save API examples.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Because scripts aren't always running properly, I'm having issues with the headers key or values not updating in bulk edit (Globals Environments). On occasion, but not always, I had issues with authorization for getting end points. However, I like this tool and find it useful.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm working on Enterprise Advice Services to create a microservice, so to create a batch in Postman is playing a leading role because every testing or debug to by using this tool we use to register test also by postman we use to show the response to over client we use postman so it's very helpful for us and it's a very cool tool to get responses the service. That is a useful tool for me.

all_reviews.review_title: A handy API build and test tool for developers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The convenience of directly using the API and its wide variety of API support makes PostMan my default API test and build tool. Plus it's cloud save and sync feature allows to publish and share api docs to colleagues and teammates very convenient and time-saving.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The tabs can be in my opinion managed in an elegant way.  It can be borderline difficult to find my previously opened tabs as the opened collection of tabs get larger and larger. I can barely see the name of the request.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Communicating with the APIs has made the whole process of API development much faster. It allows me to use different types of payloads like JSON,form-data even raw. Sending files and images to the request is also easier. The convenience of setting headers to request is my favorite feature.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman as an environment for developers helps to analyze the overall pace of data's nature.
It's like a guide walking through the outcome of your API response with all the possible information.
Allows one to time the response and its server status code to understand the communication.
An overall must-use software to get around the workflow of your API interaction with 3rd party technology.

What do you dislike about Postman?
It needs to be user-friendly and easy to understand the use of the software.
If you export the collection from the postman you should be able to edit & import the same changes in the postman collection.
It doesn't give you the right error message if you loose the server connection.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Master the basics of API interactions and workflow before you consider to work on Postman.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
It reduces the time to create a file where you have to manually define the API workflow and then be able to use it fully.
It helps to trace the server status code where you can map the exact communication happening with the server and its request.

all_reviews.review_title: Its one of the best tools for API testing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I have been using Postman for more than one year and would like to tell few things I like most:
- Simple and user friendly UI.
- You can create environment to put all the api test link for a particular project
- Can apply various authentication type with link
- Covers all methods(POST, GET, PUT, DELETE etc)
- Cloud save which helps in syncing all the data.
- Dark Mode available!
- Supports Linux, Windows and MacOS

What do you dislike about Postman?
When I started using it for the first time, even though its UI is excellent but due to so many many buttons and options provided on the same screen, it was a little confusing at first. As I am using it in Ubuntu, there is a bug currently regarding the cursor, which gets tiny on hovering on the windows.

It's even beneficial for frontend developers also as I used it often while creating frontend with React.js whenever I encountered any issue with server connection as a check. I am provided with a ton of feature with this application for free which I very much appreciate and love.

all_reviews.review_title: REST API testing tool - POSTMAN
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman gives you power to check and test individual modules of a developing web application through REST endpoints functionality checks. The thing which makes it unique is it allows one to create workspace and manage their testing more efficiently. It saves all the APIs run earlier and helps you to navigate between them more easily. The UI is also intuitive. I guess it supports all types of verbs available in calling web services starting from GET,POST .. to LINK, UNLINK. There is also support for a wide range of authentication mode for API test. Another unique feature to site is pre request script where one can write javascript which will be executed before the request is made. Data visualization for payload headers, body is also impressive. One can select data format of the payload and response and accordingly your data syntax will get highlighted for better readability. One more unique feature I came across lately is postman interceptor, a small chrome extension which allows user to use the cookies right from the chrome browser, so one need not to give auth details in case he/she is already logged into the application while testing the APIs.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Its not a dislike but postman only supports REST API request , it would be better if SOAP calls can also be made through it. I guess there is no downside of this application.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
I would definitely  recommend POSTMAN to those who are building web services or in a learning phase or designing the architecture of a network based application. Its a great tool for testing purpose as well, to separately test individual modules and functionality of an application.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Currently I am working on developing APIs and web services, so clients like Postman is of immense help while testing the functionality before incorporating the web service into the application. It also helps to understand the APIs and responses when it comes to integrating any third party application.

all_reviews.review_title: Easiest API testing tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a very straightforward API testing tool with no comlications at all. Postman makes it simple and easy to use. You can do more with default processes, apply variables, input files, set schedules. Simply, you can make the app work for you !. Postman provides an excellent framework for writing automated tests for our software. It is easy to edit and use complete test suits with a single click. Allows you to test your API. It is very easy to keep different APIs organized. Managing testing is also good. It is very helpful in or posting your configuration and sharing it with your partner. The ability to write test scripts is a very rewarding feature. Very easy to set up. Supports obtaining the desired results in a timely manner.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I don't have many dislikes here; the software is excellent, and it does what I expect it to do. More recently, the software was reversing the changes itself. Sometimes this happens as you are writing a test. Sometimes, the changes are gone when you return to the collection the next day. There seems to be a problem with the sync function. We often notice that packages that have been completely removed go back to work, seemingly just a coincidence. Sometimes it does not provide a complete picture of why the API failed. "Add certain topics to your application, regardless of your authorization, and sometimes this leads to an error response from my background APIs.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
I will recommend using Postman to newbies to the technology or API testing also.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am currently working in an IT Company, and I need to test some API daily as if any cases failed business will effect. Postman has become a handy tool for me to test API. Also, my company recommends using Postman to employees.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman is a great tool for tracking data from API but not as good as Insomnia
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I like how simple the UI is. It is very easy to set up an API call and it guides you through the possible fields that are in an API call. I like how it saves your past requests in the top bar like an internet browser does, allowing you to go back to requests you've made if you need to send them again. I think it is overall quite user friendly and does not take long to load up when I start the application.

What do you dislike about Postman?
It does not seem as versatile as Insomnia, which I prefer to use for testing API calls and data. Insomnia makes it easy to switch between environments, and lines up all of your API calls in a left hand pane, making it easy to switch between them since you can see their names. The top bar on Postman does get somewhat crowded if you have many requests saved. I also think it would be nice to see more color coding because it makes it easier to spot variables, inputs, input values. Perhaps a demo of how to use Postman would be useful to see when first downloaded.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Good for using if you care about past requests and log of when you did those API calls. Not as helpful for autocompleting requests

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have been testing out simple API calls that require authentication, different kinds of inputs to several different APIs. I usually use Insomnia but work with a team that uses Postman so have been using it to understand how they do their API calls. One thing that Postman does better though is they save a history of calls on the left hand bar which is helpful if you want to refer to a date you were working on something in particular. I have used this several times and it is good to refer to these logs in case the structure of data  in the API changes and you would like to see the progression of data organization.

all_reviews.review_title: How Postman Saved My APIs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I was looking for a quick and easy tool to test the APIs at my place of work. I stumbled across Postman and it was love at first sight. It helped me test API endpoints quickly (REST, SOAP, or GraphQL), generate cURLs, and save preset headers just to name a few of the many great features it offers. It is a simple and intuitive UI for developers to manage the stages of the API lifecycle and as my title states it saved me and my team's APIs.

What do you dislike about Postman?
For me, there is nothing to dislike. I love this tool, and for me, it has become a lifesaver. It is the best way for me as a developer to test an API and visualize how it works.
If I had to nitpick, the latest update of Postman was a bit of an issue for my PC; I had to uninstall it and re-install it again.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Postman is a potent tool and great for REST APIs; other kinds of services work well with Postman.

all_reviews.review_content:

Easy user interface and cloud based workspace. It helps you login to your workspace from anywhere and access your APIs and scenarios on the go. Initially started as a Chrome Plugin and is now available full fledged testing and Automation tool for API and REST services. Easy and better when compared to other API testing tools..

What do you dislike about Postman?
Chrome Plugin for Postman is discontinued after the release of windows application. Multifactor authentication is missing. Cannot import projects from SoapUI or other tools.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Before the AUT is developed and integrated we can test the application using API. It supports multiple programming languages like Json, XML, CURL etc.. The best part is you can enter a JSON request and can convert it into a XML or  a CURL request in the click of a button.

all_reviews.review_content:

The ability to automate different scripts using Postman APIs which reduce the human intervention thoroughly is the best part according to me. On-the-fly testing feature is something which I used to create APIs in order fetch data of all policies as a part of recovery.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The major reason being that the functionality ofPostman being so heavy makes it very difficult to run sometimes on normal desktops. As a result the system flickers while running the system which makes it very difficult to share it with my colleagues. Also, the connectivity with database is something on which some development could be done.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?

all_reviews.review_content:

The best part is that you can test different services in different environments. Its integration and testing of the REST requests are very effective. Moreover, it's a very useful and user-friendly tool for making API calls.

What do you dislike about Postman?
There are a few flaws working with this API testing tool, and one of them is that it doesn't let you select requests folder-wise to run in the test runner, and it does not support copying requests through drag and drop.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
It allows you to maintain your workspace. [Postman] has folders to make your work easy, it's easy to share with your colleagues, and it also allows you to save the request info in my local machine. I think the most important feature is it's free to use. Overall, I find this tool very helpful. It's a good platform for user testing services.

While developing web applications, it helps me for testing the REST requests in a very effective manner. Also, it keeps the history of your last used requests, which helps in re-using those requests if I want to.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The collections for API testing don't allow the user to use API-specific certificates instead made available as a standard-setting. This makes it difficult to add and remove certs each time the API request is made. The integtrations with other tool can be made better and easier. Security testing can also be added as one of the features.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
People can blindly rely on this tool to perform all the activities regarding API like manual tests, regression tests, sanity tests, design, documentation. It's straightforward to use and provides excellent support and documentation for accessing the application. Also, the tool is free and can be downloaded quickly, and can be utilized without any limit.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm able to test the APIs of the application by creating collections and also individually. I'm able to run regression tests for these collections and also make the APIs run at specific time intervals. It provides a clean test report for the time taken with the number of passes and fails tests, along with status codes and responses. The time saved is vast as the tool provides a one-stop solution. I'm able to design and document the APIs which is created so quickly.

What do you dislike about Postman?

- I think with the free plan, users should get more member collaboration and requests numbers

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
- I usually make lots of APIs for testing these APIs I generally use postman as my first tool.
- Having documented API request-response makes everyone life easier (tester, co-developer, client)

all_reviews.review_title: Review of Postman
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I enjoy the ability to test REST API's with ease. It also saves my history so I can go back and review API's that I have called previously for quick reuse. I don't have to worry about remembering how to do something I did previously.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I downfall of Postman is that you're mainly limited to just REST API's for the most part. It is not well designed for other services, so if you have something else like a SOAP API, then you'll probably want to use a different tool.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
It is great for REST API's but for other kinds of services, you may want to consider a different platform.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I test and troubleshoot REST API's with this tool before plugging them into a front end. This tool ensures that my services are working correctly before calling them from a different application.

all_reviews.review_title: Software Developer review after daily usage
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The thing I like best about Postman are:
1. We can organize the requests in folders along with request type, URL, and many other details.
2. Can switch between environments (local/production) using the top right dropdown.
3. All my requests are synced with their servers and can be accessed anywhere in the world.
4. Can Invite more users to use the same workspace.
5. Now postman is also available directly on the browsers(SAAS) without any installation.
6. Available across

What do you dislike about Postman?
I don't have any dislikes for Postman, from all aspects postman excels my expectations. The UI is great, the tools are bang on and useful.
The only thing I wish postman to implement is an extension for different code editors so that we can use basic features of postman without even switching tabs.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Problems that I solve are:
1. Test the API integration using various features. I extensively use the env drop down to quickly switch between local and production env.
2. While creating requests I can modularize it and therefore document it to make it easily reuseable by different programmers.

API collections where I can store my endpoints in a structured and organised way.

all_reviews.review_title: Friendly tool to test APIs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is relatively easy to use!
It has a friendly interface and is easy to learn by yourself. No tutorials are needed.
Results are shown in a separate box with many valuable details.
There is a test tool that can help stress the endpoint.

What do you dislike about Postman?
If you don't take care of the collections you are using, maybe will be some time where you will become lost in your collections. I mean, you need to organize your collections in folders to know where the endpoint is that you need to test.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
If you are a developer or a QA you can use postman to test your APIs. Is easy and friendly to use, and has an astronaut in the toll icon :)

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
As a QA, I need to test a lot of endpoints during a workday. Postman is a friendly and helpful tool to solve the problems that I face in this case.
Most of the time, it gives me speed in my workdays since I don't need to use a Linux Terminal to execute and expect results of an endpoint using, for example, curl.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman is the best API testing tool.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a very handy tool for testing your API's endpoint. It has almost all HTTP requests available which can be used in API development (GET, PUT, POST, DELETE...). It has a very easy and user-friendly interface. It has a variety of auth models, you just need to define auth details and the authorization header will be included with your request. Postman allows you to organize all your work into different collections to keep your workspace organized. You can convert your API request to code for all popular languages like C#, JavaScrip, NodeJs, PHP, Python, etc. Postman allows you to write test suites, build requests with dynamics parameters, and many more. It allows you to monitor your API, and on any failure, you will be received the alert. You can create a Mock server, which lets you simulate endpoints and their responses in a collection without setting up a back end.

What do you dislike about Postman?
There is nothing to dislike in Postman except two things, sometimes it is hard to understand the error generated on the failure of API. Postman works very well with Rest API but it is not as helpful for SOAP APIs.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
I strongly recommend this product for APIs developers and testers to use in their organization.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
With the help of Postman, I can develop new APIs, monitor existing ones, and perform testing to remove any possible errors that could lead to a decline in revenue and customer dissatisfaction.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman for API Testing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a free tool for API testing. It is a very easy to use and easy to deploy tool. It supports multiple plugins and 3rd party softwares. We can test API in a very fast and effective manner.Not much of this product is to be disliked as it is doing its job properly. But there are some minute glitches that should be fixed for a smoother working. For example, at times it is unable to provide a complete description of the API failure and that becomes a headache for me sometimes.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Not much of this product is to be disliked as it is doing its job properly. But there are some minute glitches that should be fixed for a smoother working. For example, at times it is unable to provide a complete description of the API failure and that becomes a headache for me sometimes.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Most of the time, I use Postman for the API call-related concerns to automate some processes like assigning user roles, running, executing, or planning the particular bot, downloading the processed, failed, unclassified and untrained files. I don't think there is any product that can beat the efficiency reliability that we get from Postman. But a small group of people might have considered Microsoft as their second option. But still, it is their second option; the first one is always the Postman.

The simplicity of the platform is best. One of the most user-friendly apps there is in the market.
It makes collaboration easy, just invite your teammates to your workspace, and boom... there you go. If you want to share the api with some external party just share the collection. Awesome product.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Sometimes, if you are switching environments and you forgot to initialize the variable in the environment, the global variable is carried forward to the request which is annoying sometimes.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
If you want to test your api, you can explore postman it is better than using curl request in the first place and various web clients as they do not provide detailed logs if something went bad.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am testing my API in postman first before automating them on the code. It helps me to check if the API is working in the first place or not. And if there are some errors, it gives a detailed log in the console.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman is useful, but hard to navigate.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is very useful for calling endpoints. Using this services enables me to do my job better, and analyze specific issues with what is in specific endpoints. In addition, this is an awesome gateway into devolpment, and coding.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Postman is hard to navigate. For example, if I want to export an environment file, one must navigate through a few different layers of buttons to push. The user experience wasn't bad but could be better.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Utilizing postman allows me to look at the layers of environments we have set up. In addition, it allows me to focus on one piece of the puzzle (calling an endpoint) and see what our endpoint is spitting back out.

all_reviews.review_title: API Development made super easy with Postman
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The best thing I like is that we can easily create Mock API, which is very useful in the application development when we dont have an actual REST endpoint

What do you dislike about Postman?
It could have better integrations for other types of APIs like SOAP, GraphQL

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
I would definitely recommend using Postman for your API development and testing. It has all the different CRUD operations like GET, POST, DELETE, PUT and so on. You can save your APIs with respect to your projects in collections. It gives a beautiful interface to edit and add content to APIs. You can also add authentication if you are testing APIs for your organizations.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I usually use Postman to test whether the REST APIs are working correctly or not in a straightforward manner. Whenever I encounter a network error, I go straight to Postman, try the API functionality, and see the error messages, which help me debug my applications. Also, I use Postman to create mock API endpoint as I am primarily a frontend developer, and because of Postman, I don't have to wait for the backend team to develop the API for me to use. I can leverage the power of Postman to create a mock-endpoint with the response type as I need in my app and then provide that to the backend team to develop.

easy config the environment variables that allow me to switch between different code env and different endpoints with ease.

some time it just doesn't work for open the link in the browser, it almost always open a new postman window. Sharing could be better share the endpoint with the environment varibles. all_reviews.review_title: Postman - A greate tool for API testing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is an excellent tool for developers to test their applications. Users can write scripts to execute requests at the collection level, request level, etc. We can construct a complex request structure in postman. Users can send multipart/form-data, include multiple headers and authorization tokens in requests. The best thing about Postman is we can share the collections with other team members easily. Also, you can sync up your data with account.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The main thing  I dislike about Postman is it is not ideal of SOAP APIs testing. Other tools like SOAP UI, katalon studio has much better support for SOAP APIs testing. Also, it should support integration with other tools like JIRA and confluence.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're using Postman for testing our backend application which is basically a government portal. APIs are written in springboot. As it is a very big project in itself it has hundred's of APIs. Testing those APIs is a very big challenge. Hence postman feature allows us to share our collection with other team members and have a better collaboration. We're using scripts to run and test APIs at scale.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman - API testing tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
A postman is a tool used for API testing. It tests the HTTP requests through which we can test different types of responses that need to be subsequently validated.

What do you dislike about Postman?
We can not test SOAP API using postman and other APIs, postman only supports RESTful APIs. It has a limited testing area and also low script reusability means tester/developer have to create new test request/script over and over for each API/project.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am a backend developer so it helps me to test API with different request and response structures before testing from UI so it reduces work for both teams, to track requests and also it is user friendly.

all_reviews.review_title: Using only postman for api preview. Its the best of all!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I've been using Postman for about 3 years now, starting from a personal project to now also.
The best part according to me is:
1. The different types of ways to import the bundle of Api's which I receive from the backend.
2. How easily I can put my headers and payload (sometimes Form data) while calling the API helps me a lot.

What do you dislike about Postman?
All and All the product is good, nothing as much to dislike, but even after so many releases, the apps get hanged always.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
1. Visualizing the API, testing API before integrating it with the frontend saves time a lot.
2. teaching peers about the API calls that we use.

all_reviews.review_title: Best investment to make for your development team!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
- Ability to share collection between teams (even on the free plan over URLs) .
- Ability to store collections as JSON inside git and securely collaborate!
- Save multiple examples for each type of API call.

What do you dislike about Postman?
- Cannot make API calls to localhost with the web app (I understand the limitations on why this happens, but wish I didn't have to install the app).
- App lags a bit on cold start with more number of collections on windows 10.
- Would like a VS Code plugin!

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
- Easily handover knowledge transfer between teams using API collections.
- Set ENV variables like Bearer tokens for testing.
- Spend less time onboarding new talent in your company.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent and helpful tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Simple UI. Navigation is easy. Multiple collections allow for good organization. Automatic syncing of collections is incredibly helpful. Exporting collections makes sharing them very easy/helpful.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Being added to teams is tricky since the added used does not immediately have access to all collections. Request logging could be better in determining whether an error might be a gateway issue or application issue.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use Postman to test API development, which excels in that area. I am easily able to set up collections for my different APIs. The request parameter and response windows are prominent and allow me a good look into my requests/responses.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman Review
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
As a custom integrations developer, I design api endpoints for both my projects and for clients.  The time saved by using postman is incredible and much more accurate than doing everything by hand or searching through large libraries for what I need.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Postman enables code generation for any endpoint or api test you have, however, for authentication, postman has not code generation.  Wouldn't it be great to have that oauth flow already coded out in a template with the needed details?

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Everything I do with projects is custom, hand typed, work.  Postman allows me to short cut the time it takes while also testing and maintaining examples of working setup and code.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful API development and management tool for teams
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Where do I start?  Focusing on the team-based features, Postman allows its user's intuitive tools to manage APIs across teams, easy to generate documentation and code snippets, and broad testing tools across a myriad of different protocols.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Very little, actually. The biggest issue with Postman is occasional software failures, but they are usually associated with a poor build, and updates and fixes are quick to come out.  I will say that while not exceedingly expensive, the user pricing model can be a little heavy-handed.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
The team I manage creates a limited number of software products that are required to connect to various and unpredictable 3rd party APIs for our customers. We needed a tool that would help us set up and document our API requests and what the payload response would look like to ease in the integration process.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman - Lightening fast API services
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The best thing about Postman is that it is lightning fast when it comes to debugging API calls. The single ecosystem that can take care of all the GET, POST etc methods is brilliant.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The most obvious disadvantage of Postman is that it is ideal for RESTful APIs and is not as suitable for others like SOAP APIs. Having the requirement to create a new script every time some modification is required is inconvienent.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman saves a lot of time for me when I have to look at the Analytics calls firing when my browser is unable to capture them due to the fast page refresh calls.

all_reviews.review_title: Fastest API tool ever!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is very user-friendly and self-explanatory in itself. Even someone who has never used an API tool before can just launch Postman and within a few clicks just hit an API.

What do you dislike about Postman?
One of the few things which I dislike about the tool is that when you are pasting a token in headers, it also pastes a lot of space characters along with it and you have to manually delete them to make the token valid, I think that should be done automatically by the tool.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Easier to have a collection of APIs in one place which comes in handy during backend testing. We can also create environment variables for headers and params which is very helpful. Postman is available in various forms as well, a standalone app, a browser extension.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
For API Development and testing, the postman is likely to be used. We can also make collections in postman and monitor our APIs through them.
We can check several things needed for API testing, such as response time, Status codes, errors (if any), etc.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The major disadvantage of Postman is that here we can not use the code again as in Rest assured, i.e., Code Resualblity is not there.
It does not tackle the SOAK APIs efficiently, and it is limited in the area of testing as well.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Helps in developing and testing for APIs.
It helps in checking the different responses that are sent through additional requests.
Also, it is very user-friendly.
Quick and simple to create requests.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman is a great tool for software developers!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is reasonably priced at $8/month. Setup was painless and quick. Postman also allowed me to set up a team so my colleagues and I could share api's. Method calls can also be easily tested in Postman. Users can also save collections of calls to share with team members. I could not imagine web developing without the use of Postman.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Postman does not offer threat protection. The reporting capabilities are also lacking a bit. Postman does not run great on iPhone or iPad. It could also improve on the sharing capability for non-workspace users. The UI does take some getting used to, and some neat features can be hidden away. There wasn't a very detailed "getting started" guide at the launch of the application. Postman does provide documentation for getting started, but there is a bit of a learning curve involved. It would be nice to add extensions such as "Beautify" when dealing with JSON text. One thing I noticed is that you have to be a subscriber to the "Professional" edition of Postman to get the full benefits.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
I would recommend giving Postman a shot for API testing. Postman can be a very powerful tool if used correctly. There are also many tutorials available to get over the learning curve.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman helps me quickly mock api's. This helps me design and test right away. One benefit I have realized is better teamwork. On Postman, creating teams and adding users to shared schema allows for better integration and communication. I have also realized that configuring and executing HTTP requests are almost seamless in Postman.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Postman?
review_question_answers.answer: Postman is reasonably priced at $8/month. Setup was painless and quick. Postman also allowed me to set up a team so my colleagues and I could share api's. Method calls can also be easily tested in Postman. Users can also save collections of calls to share with team members. I could not imagine web developing without the use of Postman.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Postman?
review_question_answers.answer: Postman does not offer threat protection. The reporting capabilities are also lacking a bit. Postman does not run great on iPhone or iPad. It could also improve on the sharing capability for non-workspace users. The UI does take some getting used to, and some neat features can be hidden away. There wasn't a very detailed "getting started" guide at the launch of the application. Postman does provide documentation for getting started, but there is a bit of a learning curve involved. It would be nice to add extensions such as "Beautify" when dealing with JSON text. One thing I noticed is that you have to be a subscriber to the "Professional" edition of Postman to get the full benefits.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Postman:
review_question_answers.answer: I would recommend giving Postman a shot for API testing. Postman can be a very powerful tool if used correctly. There are also many tutorials available to get over the learning curve.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Postman helps me quickly mock api's. This helps me design and test right away. One benefit I have realized is better teamwork. On Postman, creating teams and adding users to shared schema allows for better integration and communication. I have also realized that configuring and executing HTTP requests are almost seamless in Postman.

I love Postman and it's a huge help in my work. It's really user-friendly, the design is nice, it's easy to understand. Instead of manually creating test records on ServiceNow tables, I'm preparing the payload once and only add minor changes each time I need to create a new record

What do you dislike about Postman?
I cannot say, that I'm facing any bigger problems during the work with Postman, but it'll be great, if there will be more functionality, for example, I would really appreciate it if it'll be possible to cover SOAP API tests and another APIs. For now it's just perfect for REST API testing

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
As I mentioned before, mainly I'm using it to create multiple records on multiple tables on ServiceNow. Also, I'm using it to check, if payloads are prepared correctly and do not contain any sensitive information

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool for API testing!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I really like the ease of use when using Postman to test any kind of API endpoints. Whether you're building out your own API or testing a service, Postman is the tool to use for any HTTP POST requests and addresses all your API testing needs!

What do you dislike about Postman?
It can be a bit difficult to find out exactly why a request isn't working, if you're trying to grab something and there's an error in the way in which you're making the request, Postman won't exactly specify if you're missing a key or certain permission, etc. But it's an overall excellent service and easy to use.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use Postman to test API endpoints of services that I'm implementing or APIs that I'm building for a project. Postman is an easy-to-use service that simplifies the API testing process, and it is super helpful when doing any kind of API development.

all_reviews.review_title: Develop and Test your API with the best tool around.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The user interface is excellent and easy to use. We can send requests to any platform with ease and edit any parameters, which is a fantastic feature. We can keep all important APIs in one library and use them when needed. We can even explore and find other user's APIs and use them as references or as required. It has a collaboration feature where a team can work together from any location.

What do you dislike about Postman?
It is expensive when it comes to the collaboration feature. The tool hangs a lot for me, and it makes the user experience not suitable. Although the tool supports all devices, it works best only with the desktop version. Documentation lacks many points and it is difficult to get around. Some more tutorials or examples must be added to improve user experience.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
I will recommend this to all the developers out there; this tool helps a lot in API testing and integration. It is open-source, and security is good. You can even check the previous requests made through the history option. Importing and exporting of API is very straightforward. We can automate the testing for API calls.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have been using this tool while developing my websites to test APIs by sending requests. The results appear in a very readable way and are easy to understand. We can share our API calls with others and even share the team library.

all_reviews.review_title: A Great API Client for Rest Services
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
* You can manage and test your Rest Services easily by using Postman. Especially if you are a developer and wants  to test your get, post or put requests it is very easy to use and test your services.
* It shares API collections.
* You can import and export your API collections or services.
* It is very user friendly.
* You can send or post requests by using different message formats such like JSON / XML and other file types by using Postman.

What do you dislike about Postman?
* It saves every call that you do which should not.
* If you are a beginner at webservices, I guess you need someone to teach you Postman. It is not easy to learn therefore I think it needs a better documentation.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
* I guess it should provide better documentation. I believe that a beginner needs a documentation to send a request properly.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
* Testing my Rest Services. Therefore I do not have to use IDEs or implement something to test API Services as Postman is enough for me to test Rest Services.

all_reviews.review_title: Most valuable tool to develop APIs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
HTTP request with different method types such as DELETE, POST, GET, PATCH and PUT supported. Required customized headers can be added in a key/pair manner. Body with HTML, JSON, and XML supported. GraphQL requests are also supported. Collections can be imported and exported easily and share with a team.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Postman is a feature rich tool and provides out of the box features to ease the API development therefore I could not find any downside of this tool.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
In every project, we develop backend APIs which cannot be immediately integrated with Frontend. Before we integrate we need to develop and test designed APIs. Postman is an excellent tool used to design, develop, modify and test RESTful APIs. Using this tool we can share mock APIs with Front end team and parallelly start development. Moreover, the testing team can also utilize this tool to test automated test cases.

all_reviews.review_content:

Moreover, the output can be viewed in JSON format, which is very helpful in analyzing the received data.

What do you dislike about Postman?

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I test my APIs using Postman. Testing the APIs directly through the application is complex. Postman gives me the flexibility to view data in the format I need (JSON). It helped me to finish my work faster.

all_reviews.review_title: Testing out endpoints without a front end
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I love that postman allows you to test out Endpoints on the Backend of an app without having to have a front-end interface built out. I also love how you can keep a historical log of all the endpoints an individual has tested to see what happened previously as well as use that information to fix bugs in an api

What do you dislike about Postman?
I dislike the limits how many request Postman will store at a time and the layout. I would prefer a dark theme layout for postman to match the IDE Im working with.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
If you work on backend applications, I would highly recommend looking into using Postman in your application for testing and developing. A really good tool to have for all backend engineers!

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
With postman, I use it to help develop and test backend API's before connecting them with the front end of the application. This makes it extremely easy to test out code we're developing in real-time to ensure data that is received it the correct data that should be going to the front end. This saves alot of headaches in the development cycle as we're able to find any bugs or issues before it reaches the front end engineers.

all_reviews.review_title: API testing with Postman
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman has a straightforward UI that allows non-technical users to interact with APIs in a meaningful way. I use it to test our APIs, as well as trigger specific jobs and processes.

What do you dislike about Postman?
There is not much to dislike. I am able to create collections of requests, and quickly duplicate them so that I can create variations. This allows me to quickly build an automated test suite.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?

all_reviews.review_title: Simple and Effective Tool for HTTP Requests. An essential in my backpack.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
It is simple and straightforward to use.

Being able to save requests and group them into collections are time-savers. Exporting them has been great for versionning.

As per the requests output, several output formatting options are available for showing the http request execution results as json, html, xml. There is a neet output option "preview" which shows the output html rendered as a webpage.

Finally, there is a code generation feature wich is very handy for generating testing scripts on PHP and other languages, that will allow to embed the request in your own code.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Authenticated requests were a bit difficult at the begining, at least on the version I used. Still, once I had it going, it was very easy to use. Maybe some guidelines could be for starting with authenticated requests, could be very usefull.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Great tool! An essential on my toolbag!

I recommend this to all Full Stack developers for debugging frontend - backend communications, like ajax calls on web pages.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use Postman to explor, test and debug API endpoints.
I can do things much more agile now.

I can quickly send requests and expriment with third party APIs.
First I do a step by step of the API conversation I will need to automate.
I do manually all the requests and document.
After is done, I just know will work and all which is left is to code it.

all_reviews.review_title: Makes testing APIs very easy. Even for a person who's never written a line of code.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
There are many things that I love about Postman; here are some :
1. provide an endpoint, and it will give you the code for using the API in whatever language you want from Python, Java, javaScript, etc.
2. You can save your frequently use requests so that you don't have to type them again & again.
3. You can save your header & payloads for as long as you want.
4. One of the most amazing things is you can write API documentations as well using Postman.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Nothing as of now. Postman helps me as a data scientist to ship & test APIs faster.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Go for it. It's the best tool for API management and collaboration out there.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Without postman, I always had to write a proper cURL request or a python function to test my APIs. This problem is solved by the Postman App, now I can use the UI & interact with my APIs.

all_reviews.review_title: A nice API management tool. Very Helpful
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The ability to make collections and save responses along with requests is just amazing to me, and the fact that it can be exported later on is even better. Very easy for developer collaboration as multiple people can be added to a team.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Though this is a long shot but I would love to have an autogeneration tool for API docs using an existing express application.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Use the creation of teams and collections features very wisely. It can help improve collaboration to an extent that no frontend developer ever has an issue in calling and expecting API results.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Collaboration between frontend and backend teams and the backend team itself. It helps the frontend team to get a wonderful idea as to what API they can call for what purpose, and what is the exact response they should be expecting out of it. They don't need to go a to a backend dev everytime they need a new API.

all_reviews.review_title: One tool an API tester should never miss.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
When an API has to be tested whether it's an third party api or self developed api, testing has made simple by its automation flow with a feature where we can call multiple requests at a time and expect the multiple response in one process. This multi threading process feature is the best of what it has got. To add one more thing is it's well built online documentation which provides wide range of knowledge on how to use.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Considering my personal experience once I was in a situation where I was writing scripts to test for a particular project but when I came to a situation where I was unable to reuse the script also this is well designed for REST APIs but not for the SOAP APIs.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I will be testing lot of third party APIs mostly REST APIs where I will be utilising the feature of bulk upload to load the multiple requests and to see the different outcomes of the APIs. Its User interface let's me group the project of APIs in well organised manner to test them in efficient way.

all_reviews.review_title: Best tool for API testing ever
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a really complete and widely adopted tool to work with APIs.
You can test your APIs, design new ones, document them, create runners (load testing's tool), create mockups, and even more.
It's an intuitive software that will allow you to start working with it almost immediately.
Also, you can create collections with all the APIs and endpoints, organized in folders and specific environments with the configuration values, which you can share with your teammates quickly.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The only thing I dislike so far is that it's not available for iPadOS. You require a MacBook or PC to install it.
Sometimes it uses a lot of resources, but it works better with every update they launch.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Don't hesitate any more and start using it. You will be delighted.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Since I started working with Postman (several years ago), I have all the APIs I use referenced in the same place, organized in the way I define, and with response samples for future use.

all_reviews.review_title: Best API testing tools in the market
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The simple user interface of this tool helps Postman to stands on a different level. I was use postman for API testing which I developed in the Django web framework. If I am talking about the testing part, we can test the CRUD operations of API using postman very quickly. During testing, we simply select GET, POST, or any other request type and give the data in the header or body. It will take a response from the server and give it to you. I have used postman for 6 months, I feel postman has lots of features that are not used by me but It is also very helpful for different applications.

What do you dislike about Postman?
personally, I don't have any features that are not helpful for me. I don't dislike any features of the postman.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
I strongly recommend using postman for API testing.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
As a backend developer, I equally working on postman as well as API development. I developed API through the Django web framework. I want to test that API whether it is working well or not. If I am doing the test with a browser then It will take lots of time and It is a lengthy process. When I used postman then I can overcome this problem and doing a great job with minimal time and less complexity. The benefits are we can use lots of postman features along with testing API. The great thing about the postman is all the basic features available with a free plan. If you want to use the advance option then you have to go for a premium plan.

all_reviews.review_title: Testing tool for webservices
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
We recently developed web services that post the JSON, Excel, XML formatted files to other projects. As its an integrated, extensive program that has various projects, this data is essential to check if coming/passing correctly or not.
Postman is so easy to use, especially with businesses with non-technical teams. We provide the URL and parameter, and they quickly get the XML, JSON file out from postman.
We use the downloaded version of Postman, but its easy for our product owners, BA, Bussiness, testers to use it on the web.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I think it will be good if more history can be maintained in the application its minimal right now. Because some time we call the same web API calls multiple times, even the same parameters to test the output. Also, I think we can only test or call one web API at a time. It will be good to have automation or multiple calls. For eg, in our automation program, project1 send data to project 2 in JSON format, then project2 sends to Project 3 in XML and then project1 get back data from project2 again in JSON. So same data flows in between the system in different formats. It will be great if we can use 3 web API calls on same screen to see all other data.
I think few more testing formats can be included like WSDL tests.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Yes, its highly recommended as it's an easy and in-built application to test your web app. The best part is it's easy to install as well as you can use it on the browser too.
I never used its mobile app, though.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are testing our program using the postman to check if all data flow correctly between the system. Whether the web API is up and running with the relevant parameters, we are going to use it in code.

Postman is so easy to use, especially with businesses with non-technical teams. We provide the URL and parameter, and they quickly get the XML, JSON file out from postman.
We use the downloaded version of Postman, but its easy for our product owners, BA, Bussiness, testers to use it on the web.

all_reviews.review_title: Amazing API Testing Tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a fantastic tool for both Developers and Testers to test APIs. The UI is relatively simple, but the tools are extensive. I like that you can easily "Beautify" code. The biggest pro is the ability to create a test case framework that comes in handy when we're doing automation testing.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The only issue that comes to mind is that logging is not the most helpful in debugging issues, and there isn't a ton of documentation if you need help with understanding something. I haven't had a problem finding answers on Google, though. I've never used the "Professional" edition, so not sure how much better that is.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm primarily using Postman to mock APIs and to test quickly instead of having to wait for complete application integration. Postman helps me catch any issues early on and modify the code/strengthen code quality.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Postman?
review_question_answers.answer: Postman is a fantastic tool for both Developers and Testers to test APIs. The UI is relatively simple, but the tools are extensive. I like that you can easily "Beautify" code. The biggest pro is the ability to create a test case framework that comes in handy when we're doing automation testing.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Postman?
review_question_answers.answer: The only issue that comes to mind is that logging is not the most helpful in debugging issues, and there isn't a ton of documentation if you need help with understanding something. I haven't had a problem finding answers on Google, though. I've never used the "Professional" edition, so not sure how much better that is.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: I'm primarily using Postman to mock APIs and to test quickly instead of having to wait for complete application integration. Postman helps me catch any issues early on and modify the code/strengthen code quality.

all_reviews.review_title: Review for Postman
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is an open source and useful tool for connecting to various types of APIs and also for API testing. It is user friendly to test the request and response of Rest APIs using Postman. Also, it can be used for automating API testing. Additionally, the APIs tested by one can easily be exported and shared with a peer in the form of collections and once that is imported, all request response and other parameters get imported.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The Api automation feature of Postman is not user friendly and and full automation cannot be achieved in all cases. So the automation should be more flexible

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am using Postman regularly in my organization for testing various Hybris APIs for my project. These APIs have various authentication like header, bearer token etc and all are supported by postman. Also, certificate authentication is supported in Postman. I test the request response of all types of API like Get, post, put, delete, patch  using Postman.

all_reviews.review_title: A fundamental, necessary tool in my QA toolbox.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
There's a long list of features that I love about Postman, so picking my favorites may be difficult. Our engineering team uses a shared workspace for most of our baseline API tests, which is fantastic, but I love that I can copy that into my workspace and make edits as needed. We also use a plethora of different testing environments with a wide range of data discrepancies, which postman allows the ability to set environment variables to smooth over any data hiccups with ease.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Something I'd like to see is having all of their features and notifications accessible within the desktop app, so I never would need to access the website.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman has helped tremendously with solving data related issues that we don't have the ability to fix via our web application's interface.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman is an excellent tool for testing APIs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is an extremely powerful tool for developing and testing APIs. It has a very handy and easy-to-use feature to generate mock APIs and API documentation. This makes it very easy to design APIs. It also has good features for creating collections and environments that can easily be used to call the same APIs in multiple different environments. Postman also has great features to translate API calls into curl requests which makes it very easy to generate requests that can be called through a command line instead of the Postman UI.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I dislike that Postman sometimes has issues with SSL and VPNs. For example, when I am connected to a VPN, it does not always propagate through Postman, and the Postman connectivity fails to those endpoints.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
The problems we are solving with Postman include being able to call APIs for testing and development. It has a useful UI that makes it very easy to construct API call requests and execute them in multiple different environments. You can also run tests in Postman which makes it very easy to test APIs easily in an automated fashion. The benefits include easy and fast development and testing for APIs.

all_reviews.review_title: Testing your API endpoints preproduction.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I love Postman because it allows me to test out API Endpoints rapidly and get results without having to build out a fully functional front end UI. My favorite feature is being able to adjust the headers to mimic different browsers and request to a test server to prepare for all possible outcomes when developing.

What do you dislike about Postman?
i dislike that postman doesnt allow you the ability to run multiple post request at the same time to simulate stress testing on a development server.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
If you are a backend developer, I would highly recommend using Postman to test out endpoints on your application, this will save you time from developing a test UI to test it out in. It will save alot of time in your development Cycle!

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
With postman, I'm able to test out our companies endpoints on new api features. This allows us to ensure they are working properly before connecting then with the front end application. We have found using postman to be best as it allows us to replicate how the standard user would interact with an application and prepare us to patch any day 1 bugs before they happen.

all_reviews.review_title: A fantastic framework for API testing.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
1. The Postman is really simple to use.
2. You can test your API without using a browser with only a few clicks.
3. It's simple to set up multiple workplaces based on your tasks and requirements, and you can even share them with your friends. This means that everyone is performing the same API testing.
4. They allow for the quick and easy addition and deletion of parameters.
5. It is simple to construct a mock test for the API.
6. They also offer cloud storage for API backups.

What do you dislike about Postman?
1. The UI, especially for beginning users, may confuse and difficult.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
The Postman is an excellent tool for testing various HTTP requests, and you can easily manipulate the REST request and response. It takes less time for new employees to become productive when they work with our existing codebase.

The ease of use as well as the quick setup. The user interface is intuitive, and collaborating and sharing projects between team members is very helpful.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The only downfall I have seen is the small number of team members you can have on the free version. For young entrepreneurs or students, this can be difficult to get the most out of a tool they can't yet purchase.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am constantly using this tool to test web service callouts and verify server responses from different tools. Talking between web applications and CRM's can be challenging to process, but this tool makes that an easy part of development.

all_reviews.review_title: Open Source tool for API testing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
That it can be used both as a web based and a stand alone application and how I can easily copy/paste, adjust and save tests, and that the answers to all questions related to using the app can be Googled (yay Open Source!)

What do you dislike about Postman?
Not much, maybe the fact that I cannot have my UI tests in it (or maybe I can, but so far I am not aware of this option)

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
If you are looking for a tool to test APIs (fast) that allows you to write test cases and also automate them, this is what you need. Integrates really nicely with Salesforce as well, tons of tutorials and guides can be found online

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use it for API testing because it is faster and easier to use than the tool that my company wants me to use, so I use Postman to find out what I want to test and how and then migrate my tests to another application

all_reviews.review_title: Best App for  Development, Testing and Managing APIs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Love the UI, and Features updates Postman gets regularly. Its great for API management with variables, folders and overall the mock servers for running test cases. Postman has been the core to all our backend API development and documentation. The workspaces works great when it comes to switching to different projects for personal or organizations APIs. Earlier Backend Developers faced lot of issues when it comes to managing API's and handover to Testing Teams, now its just few clicks to share the entire repositories or Interactive API docs making the whole process taking it very easy.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The API development will be quite easier, if there could be options to switch tab navigations to a vertical sidebar instead of Horizontal, as more tabs in horizontal mode, makes it hard to switch to the tabs. Otherwise Its great overall product which is fast and provides all the features to make it easy and saves time and cost, which otherwise would eat lot of development time for the developers.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
If you are looking for a API collaboration tools for your development tool which is easy to use and accessible using both GUI and Web and performs testing automation too, you should definitely checkout Postman. It has a great community and documentation with all the exciting feature releases and upgrades. A Tool which will help your teams improve productivity and collaborate both devs with testers. Highly recommended.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
We build, test and deploy our API's using Postman. Our testers get help from the test cases and the overall experience that is provided by the Postman Interface is really helpful when it comes to managing large number of APIs and maintaining their changes or versioning them. The GUI works well with any OS, making life easier for developers and testers to test them by having full control over the API's history. Overall a great tool if you want to get rid of the cli. Works well with both free and enterprise need.

all_reviews.review_title: Testing your Backend Endpoints for your API and Applications
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I love how easy postman makes it to test your backend APIs without having to develop a front-end UI to test everything. I also love that you can get the API outputs pre-formatted into great documentation to use internally.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I dislike that Postman will only save upto 500 request in it's history, it makes it harder to go back and check on failed attempts to request an endpoint on an api.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
If you want to quickly test your API's with features that will blow away regular browsers, I highly recommend using Postman

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
With Postman, I am able to test out the endpoints of our API for our application and ensure they are working properly before letting the front-end Engineers connect the front-end with the backend.  I have found Postman to be the best application to have this done as we are able to easily mock GET, POST, PUT, & PATCH request within a local server. Having this done without deploying the API allows us to make quick edits to the API when needed.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I like that Postman automatically syncs any changes I do on my local workspace to the team workspace in the cloud. The response time marker is also great for testing response speed times. The sandbox is also a great feature allowing me to work when I am offline.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I am still looking for a way to generate api documentation automatically from Postman. I also had a bad day trying to troubleshoot code when in fact Postman was sending the URL with white space :( .

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am able to test APIs on my local machine without having to do a deployment on the server. I can also easily share my API structure with the team that is going to be consuming them and this saves a lot of time.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
You don't really need to be a programmer or a Computer Science major to understand how to develop a test for an API with Postman in sharp contrast with doing that by a normal text editor or by CLI, it makes it approachable to understand each of the values and parameters in an API. If you know what you are doing it can cut your time trying to write tests and executing them in half.

What do you dislike about Postman?
It is not an issue with the program itself, since it fulfills the role really well, but the way how some people use it to test APIs, it isn't a magic wand, if a parameter isn't in the API then even if you set it on Postman and looks like a valid parameter it won't work since it is not a valid input even if the syntax looks ok.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
It is awesome but not a replacement for reading the API documentation

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Creating and testing APIs across different systems.

all_reviews.review_title: Golden standard for working with api and HTTP in general
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is the best tool to work with HTTP and to write/integrate/connect/test APIs in general and just some AJAX calls as well. Interface is very easy and understandable. You can use variables and even write scripts. This tool can be also used for some king of automated testing suites building. When you login with your account, your whole calls history, collections and everything else is saved and is accessible from any device. When working with many of 3rd party APIs, you will find ready Postman collections that they provide for easier integration. Nowadays you cannot work as a Software Developer in Web or a Quality Assurance Engineer in Web without using this tool. If you don't know how to use it, then quickly start learning.

What do you dislike about Postman?
There are no disadvantages that I can thing about. Only thing is that you need to understand how HTTP is working, without such understanding you will be unable to use this tool. But this cannot be considered as a disadvantage, it is how it is.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
You need to learn HTTP basics before working with postman. Know authorization, headers, referrers, etc. Without this you will not be able to work with that tool.
If you are not using Postman but instead using some console tools like curl, then quickly switch to Postman, it has nice UI and a lot of good features.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman helps to solve development problems with AJAX calls and APIs. It is tool number one when you are integrating some 3rd party APIs as well.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Postman helps to solve development problems with AJAX calls and APIs. It is tool number one when you are integrating some 3rd party APIs as well.

all_reviews.review_title: A must have software for REST based testing for Devops and Developers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Small learning curve because of its very intuitive UI.
Support for adding Collections for your product APIs. Using a Simple JSON file one can easily add a collection with the details of all the endpoints and use cases covered in the post organized way possible. This makes importing exporting of API endpoints very handy.
Very rich and organized UI to save credentials and automap the credentials to the collection in a single click.
Being a developer I really enjoy the 'code' feature which easily translates your API request into any currently used language. This is a boon to the developers, they no more need to write code from scratch to integrate it into their code. Postman is an open source tool to test any http/https based apis. Its Simple UI makes learning curve to use it very simple also it doesn't require any prior knowledge of any programming knowledge.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I feel there is a need for some open-source Postman collation repository for all opensource APIs available at a click from within the app. Because this is something all the developers will love to have. Webhook endpoints for all common opensource APIs will also be very appreciated.
It would be great if network packet sniffing and features that fiddler provides are also incorporated in fiddler. For this very problem, I always need to open both the apps at the same time.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Hitting microservice endpoints using various a user frienly dropdown for all the http verbs which we know till and it keeps on adding new ones for example VIEW, PROPFIND,UNLOCK,LOCK,PURGE,COPY etc are some of the rare http verbs which i think are only integrated with this tool. And I also did the opposite of using code from the request format.
