all_reviews.review_title: Making the process of testing APIs so easy!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Using it is so simple. I remember when I first tried it, I was a complete newbie, and I was worried about how to use it. I had developed my web application, and I needed to test my RESTful APIs, and check if they were working correctly or not. In just 30 mins, I figured out everything. So basically I would say is, they make testing APIs very easy, and they have great User Interface (UI).

What do you dislike about Postman?
There are no such big complaints, that I can make. However, I'd like to suggest if they can make the application a little more lightweight in future updates, then that would be great. This will help users who are using older laptops with older configs.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have developed web applications and have written REST APIs. If you are making it for the smaller use case, or personal use, it might be okay that you don't test it or make corrections in a manual way. But, if you are working on a big project or professional project, you have to perform end-to-end testing. And for me, Postman made this task very easy and efficient. I can quickly figure out what is wrong, make the necessary changes, and test it again. I can check responses in various formats, can check all types of HTTP or HTTPS requests very quickly. So, it has helped in web development.

all_reviews.review_title: Fabulous & a Must Tool for API Developers & QA's!!!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
This software is very useful tool and very much set up and use. You can use it through the whole cycle of API development
And testing as well. The documentation I find it is very useful and connectivity functionality is amazing as well. Flexibility of defining multiple environments is very helpful while testing and also you can use javascript to write your test cases.

I am QA and I would recommend this tool for all testers who are working on API testing.

What do you dislike about Postman?
There are not too many major flaws which effects the overall quality of the software but might be licensing for some features which are available in other rival softwares like Katalon or to able to select multiple folders inside a collection for execution.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
As I mentioned above, Postman is amazing software for the API testers and developers which really sorts all API requirements and helpful in achieving their desired results with minimum fuss and reliability. I recommend this Postman app for all companies who are looking for reliable and stable API tool for their businesses.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I used postman predominantly for API Testing which is very easy and helpful. I test authorisation of headers, token, & response body etc in my tests. I work in different environments & write tests (some predefined and some user defined using javascript). I could use these saved tests in collections which allows me to reuse again whenever I need without writing repeat tests and saves time for me to deliver good quality output. I share my collections with other team members as well for the references to implement if required.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman is as Intuitive as it Gets
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I like that Postman automatically encodes spaces and other symbols in REST requests. I also like that I can easily input fields and filters (among other things) in their own separate fields, but they are placed into the REST request where they belong appropriately.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I do not like that it is not easy for me to easily navigate back to previous requests without having to switch through many tabs and click multiple times. It is inferior to Fiddler in this regard. I also do not like that Postman does not make it as easy to save and re-load saved requests compared to other software.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Postman is wonderful for people who are not used to manually created their own REST requests and want to pick up on how they are put together easily and intuitively. I suggest getting used to typing out your specific queries in separate locations because Postman will combine them all into one singular request when you are finished.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am able to run many automated API tests and multiple REST requests every day. I am also able to build REST requests easily through this software.

all_reviews.review_title: My Feedback About Postman
all_reviews.review_content:

What do you dislike about Postman?
There is only one restriction in this tool, while we selecting the parent folder which contains more children folder inside the parent folder, the runner will run only the APIs available inside the first children folder

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
As a tester or developer, you can use the postman for multiple purposes like testing the APIs and do automation in whatever you like, so you can reduce your working time.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
To overcome the above-mentioned issue, they given one script to navigate to a particular API, so we can use that option.

4. When used for testing purpose monitoring of test cases is difficult
5.unlike new tools postman don't have features of codeless web service testing

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Read the documentation to get broader view about its field of use, it's best api testing tool , almost in every big mncs it's being used

2. Verifying our internal project developed apis before exposing them
3. Testing, Developing and documenting our apis
4. Creating dummy backend to test our frontend
5. Testing api endpoints and debugg with test requests and payload

all_reviews.review_title: One of the best Application  for testing APIS
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
This is really helpful for the back end developers to test the APIS. Developers don't need to wait for the others output because they can test and run APIS via this application.It is easy to setup and also it is very user friendly.You can create and save API collections according to the various projects .You can create different types of API Requests such as POST,PUT,UPDATE,GET,DELETE and etc.Furthermore You can set parameters,headers,authorization keys and etc.It supports many response types such as JSON,XML,HTML,JavaScript and etc.In the latest postman update,they have integrated the GraphQl queries.So that now we can check both REST APIS and not REST APIS .

What do you dislike about Postman?
Postman  does not support for the multiple concurrent API requests.When we are working on a project which uses micro-services, we have to run and check each service separately.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
I would like to recommend Postman Application because It has a very simple user friendly interface.If you are a  beginner to the Rest API developing, this will be really helpful to you.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
As a Software Engineer postman is really helpful  and it makes my job role easier.We can save APIS and track the responses.It provides facility to share APIS as a documentation.Further we can share the Postman Api collection between the project members.So that every one can edit the APIS.

all_reviews.review_title: If you deal with APIs use postman
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a must have for any API developer, building APIs can be a hassle but Postman does a lot of grunt work so that developers can concentrate on what they do best. I came to know about postman from a conference where an API expert was showing a demo of their API and I fell in love with this software from that day onwards.

Automated test running: If your rest API is on the cloud, you can use postman to run periodic tests and status checks and reports back if anything is amiss.

Multiple response type supports: Postman allows users to deal with APIs that respond with JSON, XML and plain HTML pages too.

Debugging APIs: If I use postman, I am easily able to view cookies, get cookies, set cookies and much more.

Affordaitlty: Postman is priced right it is neither too expensive not cheap, it has hit the pricing right.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Postman is not open source software, it is a paid proprietary software, I wish someone comes up with an open source version of it.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
If you can not afford postman, you can use chromes debugging tools.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
It helps me manage and control my API development workflow.

all_reviews.review_title: Build custom web products with Postman
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is very easy to set up. It provides quick links to headers, replies, and data regarding debugging.  The test manager and the testing factor system saves a lot of time. It really is perfect for checking API endpoint health inspections, monitoring the API performance or error reactions.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Compared with the web version, the Plugin is not as robust as I would expect. I would also like Postman to use an external device for UX research, something our project manager has been claiming for a long time.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Postman is suitable for companies that are looking for a tool to check and fix APIs or even simple online apps. This valuable tool has helped me to solve problems with consumers rather than trying to exacerbate problems all the time they appear. Of course if your system does not have a server template or you don't usually communicate with third-party APIs, Postman will not be entirely effective to your group code.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have used Postman to check our workflows and build custom web products by extending to Micro Products and other fields. It is also used to promote encryption and pre-request texts if current captions are to be created to submit the application. I really like that Postman lets me always explain what JSAN APIs are and get clear information on how they function for people from other parts of the market who do not usually know about APIs.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman is awesome for HTTP request testing and automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman provides the ability to store the HTTP request by collections and sub-collections. This is great if you have multiple systems standalone or integrated together. I've not reach a limit in the amount of HTTP request you can store on a collection but for now is huge!

You can work with all the HTTP methods and Postman will allow you to store those with the desired method even if the URI is the same.

Another awesome feature is the environment variables and global variables. You can set those for a UAT, QA, DEV, or Production environments. Works perfectly. You will be able to even combine these variables with a Pre-Test script. For example you could set a date time String with a desired format and store it as a variable, then you can use this variable within your HTTP request (in the URI or body)

What do you dislike about Postman?
I dislike the inconsistent updates.  I had huge amount of Examples one or many per HTTP request stored and those got corrupted or lost when updating Postman to a newer version.

I have to delete cookies every time I'm doing a request to avoid systems to pick up the wrong credentials or data. This do not happen with all of the systems I'm submitting HTTP requests to.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Please check out tools like JMeter and compare with Postman before considering it. It might be a good tool for you or your company.

all_reviews.review_title: My views on Postman

It's robust, lightweight user-friendly API. Integration with other tool is seamless. This tool is pretty much helpful during the development and testing of service requests.
Using this API we are easily able to test complex test cases as well.
Service request history information detail is efficient to check the overall load of received requests and if required then we can send these request again to cross verify the results.
Performs efficient testing of services and performance wise application is good enough and pretty much secure tool.
It's Dashboard is awesome as each item has a sperate section to analyse the actions like collections, history, environments, monitors, mocks etc. so it's easy to use.
Workspace creation process is super simple. It allows to create separate workspaces for Personal and Team use.
In this API collections view is awesome.

What do you dislike about Postman?
So far it's awesome and meeting our business requirements.

It's a stable and secure tool for http requests. Overall efficient test suits.

We have created automated test cases. Performed load testing through numerous simultaneous requests.
During testing process monitored the service requests nicely.

all_reviews.review_title: The world runs on APIs and postman helps build good APIs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
It is not an understatement if one said the entire world runs on API also known as application programming interfaces. We are an API vendor and without API testing features, life would be much hard for us. With the advent of reload less single page applications, APIs become mandatory for all software development oriented organizations. Postman is an all in one tool box that helps us take care of API architecture, building, testing, deployment and maintenance. These are my top likes in Postman API management platform

Debugging APIs: Debugging to find and fix bugs on APIs is an arduous task with command line clients like curl, so before we started using postman we used to write complex python scripts with our parameters stored in environment variables, but with postman, we care able to use a nifty GUI to change parameters in a jiffy and make sure our bugs are eradicated and they work as intended

Support for multiple request types: Postman supports all REST api requests like Get, Post, Put and Delete.

Support for multiple response types: Postman also supports the rendering of multiple response types like JSON, XML, HTML and raw text. It can also render the document object model based on the user agent used.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I am not in a position to dislike anything about postman.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
There is no real competition to postman, so if you're considering postman, go for it. Many tech giants use Postman and they are not wrong.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Build and scale APIs from the ground up.

all_reviews.review_title: The best api testing tool and boon for frontend developers.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
There are many things to list down here:
1. Postman is a complete package as far as api testing is concerned.
- You can create a basic request, the user experience is very friendly. Simple dropdown to select type of request type, pass body, headers and what not in a very easy way
- You can create a collection of all your endpoints with the result and share them across the team bringing the communication required for integration of api between a frontend and backend developer to zero and saves a lot of useful time.
- You can create different environments like local, staging, production or any other of your choice and test the same endpoint across different environments.
- You can create and publish beautiful api documentation, and publish it making

What do you dislike about Postman?
Well, there is everything that you can think of it in from api testing point go view.
You can create simple request, different environments, environment variables, collections, pass and see request headers, request authorisation, body parameters in raw, form-data, binary, x-www-form-urlencoded, graphql, in json, xml, text, html, js format
I can't think of anything that I disliked, the ease of access is also superb and comes very natural.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
I have seen software developer firms, where backend developer after finishing their task story sit with front-end developers and explain them how to consume the api.
Which is very time consuming and an odd process to follow.
Postman is the key here, automates the process and no communication or explanation would be required.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are a team of software developers, primarily using javascript, many a times we divide our tasks like taking on the backend development first and pass on the api endpoints to members working on the frontend tasks which make them helpful to understand and see the exact response from the server and help them design the entities and use data structures accordingly.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to test Rest API with Postman Tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
- Postman is very simple and easy to use also it is a secure tool, So I don't worry about my API collection and environment variables.
- I can easily add my API request in my collection, set headers, adds params and select method GET/POST and easily test it.
- Also, I'm able to run whole collection APIs using Postman. Its a nice feature to all APIs in one click.
- Also, I can set and create environments variable in environment files and Run and test collection in a different environment. Ex: Local, Develop, QA, Production.
- Also, I can easily share and export, import my collection and environment files, with postman security.
- Postman is syncing all collection and environment files in my signing account. I'm able to easily access all collection and environment files at any time and any device. because the tool is compatible with almost all device.

What do you dislike about Postman?
- I have no dislike about Postman Because the postman is really full feel my requirements and all needs.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
- I'm still using postman to create and test the REST APIs in my company projects.
- It's really helping me to create bugs free API.
- Also, I can create all types of requeset easily with Postman.
- Also, I can run and test authenticated api using - Authorization: Bearer {{ACCESS_TOKEN}}
- Postman filter feature really nice, I can easily search and find APIs.
- Postman has provided simplistic UI and efficienclly work.

all_reviews.review_title: The best API development collaborative tool !
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Intuitivo, semplice da utilizzare. Anche la versione free fornisce numerosi strumenti per lo sviluppo, il debug, il testing e il monitoraggio di API tutto con la possibilita di collaborare con i membri del proprio team.
E' possibile gestire il versionamento delle API.
Utilissima la possibilita di testare in ambienti multipli semplicemente passando pia indirizzi.
Molto utile inoltre la parte di learning direttamente integrata sul launchpad dell'applicazione. Diferse lezioni e tutoria sono disponibili per apprendere piu velocemente l'utilizzo del software.
La UI risulta essere davvero confortevole grazie all'implementazione del tema dark.
Molto utile anche la history per richiamare, avendo a portata di mano, quanto implementato in precedenza.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Anche se il costo del prodotto non e eccessivamente elevato, alcune funzionalita molto utili sono disponibili solamente nella versione a pagamento.  Confrontando altri software simili queste vengono offerte gratuitamente.
La fase di autenticazione in alcuni casi poo risultare confusionaria.
Dal punto di vista delle performance, soffre di latenza nel caso in cui il quantitativo di dati richiesti sono molto elevati ed inoltre quando i tab aperti sono numerosi.
Nel complesso Postman ci consente di sviluppare e operare in maniera produttiva.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Prodotto facile e veloce da usare. Molto affidabile e permette di operare collaborando con altri membri del team.
Consigliatissimo !

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Utilizziamo in maniera intensiva Postman per il controllo di cio che viene esposto dal nostro sito web. I dati devono rispettare alcuni standard per la corretta gestione da software terzi.
La possibilita di lavorare in team ci permette di collaborare e identificare in maniera molto efficiente eventuali anomalie nello sviluppo delle API.

all_reviews.review_title: Work with API tests and manage web apps
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is the way you perform API contacts and test. It is very simple to use and reliable. It is certainly very good at fulfilling all of our requirements.  Also, Postman will allow you to exchange the setup query and output questions with your colleagues so that everybody can check.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I wish Postman could have greater UI functions, as right now I think it is too simple.  Also, Postman is targeted to be used mostly in difficult situations so, for relatively simple requests, the restrictions can be overcrowded, and the overwhelming majority of the clients in our company just use the fundamentals of reasonable requests.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
I suggest Postman if your company is constantly in charge of managing and developing APIs. Postman is also a fantastic tool for teamwork, as you can also share requests for configuration with all your team members so that everyone can evaluate and monitor from everywhere.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman is actually being used by our IT department to make API tests and to create and manage web apps. Before acquiring Postman, I researched a range of sophisticated tools and found out that Postman was the best suited for the most complex circumstances. We use it multiple times a week as we provide APIs to most of our clients, and Postman is the right tool to do that. Our IT design team takes advantage of the whole of our endpoints on our publicly available programmer documents site.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
With the help of Postman, I can execute my REST API (even in any formate of response such as HTML, JSON, JavaScript etc) efficiently. Another good thing here in Postman is that I can simultaneously work on many different projects and different them by grouping pannel. It is the most convenient tool to use, As it comes also as a Google Chrome browser extension which is best because I don't have to install the whole setup file.  Also, You can also set up your parameter, heady and body content for testing purpose in any API. which is really a need for a thorough the testing framework.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Sometimes, in postman, syncing is less trustful, due to the low network bandwidth and a number of developers make changes in same API at the same time.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Postman is a tool to test REST API in an easy way; learning curve here is very steep. Also, it is free of cost. So, I definitely recommend it to try once.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman is my primary tool to test the request and response structure of any API that is developed by the Database Programmer. Also, with the help of this, I do make sure that all API is working correctly and giving proper response when used with actual code communication.

What do you dislike about Postman?

all_reviews.review_title: API monitoring, creation, and automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
With Postman, working with colleagues is simple and the GUI is very clear. It will allow you to request formation conveniently from simple GETs, POSTS, or PUTs. It offers a free edition that can be used to check the wellbeing of your system at the end of your development process. Besides, Postman handles transparent processes, so from leadership to manager level, we are all able to see what's happening. Also, the test generator has a lot of incredibly strong features, some of them allow us to save parameter outcomes from an application, which is amazing. Besides, it is so simple I have been able to tell people and in semi-technical roles how and when to use it so they can know how APIs operate.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Postman does not have a good way to track the test cases, something I wish could improve soon. I have nothing negative left to say about this amazing software.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Postman is really useful for validating API safety checks, the review system for your API tests and the error report. It will allow you to build API frameworks so you can seamlessly and quickly save answers for the application for callouts and monitor all your APIs.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Postman in the IT department for API monitoring, creation, and automation. We also use it to design demands and add or eliminate variables quickly and effortlessly and to check and customize the curl application on the API endpoint.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman API Helper a great helper tool for mobile developer
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Easiness of API execution I like the most in postman.

Collection sharing between team is also nice feature. It will make whole team on same page.
Sharing collection using link is also nice feature.

While executing HTTP URL passing parameter was tedious task for all developers. Here easiness of passing form data parameter is works like charm.

When you want to check validation on the API side then you just need to uncheck parameter. and checked again for include it in request.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I appreciate to provide feature like environment and use of that is somewhat tedious. Sometime once all the environment variable lost their value. They are not indicating or making it highlighted to get attraction of users.

Many time it crashes while there is maximum usage of RAM. They need to look into optimisation process for handling all the crashes due to out of memory.

Because it is a tool which is helpful to developers. And usually IDE of various technology uses maximum memory. So they need to improve.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Just one recommendation... Make your build stable for ubuntu. I faces maximum issues in Ubuntu 18.04.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Very useful while developing mobile application. Sometimes mobile developers need some documentation while integrating API's to the application. But postman itself provides all information regarding API's

Even they are providing folder pattern so you can manage your various packages of API's and prepare collections and share it with team so everyone get notified while any changes need to take or not

all_reviews.review_title: Great Platform for Web Service Request Testing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
-- Good Application for Web Service Request Response observation.
-- Very User Friendly and Light too handle.
-- Most accurate result for each web services.
-- You can save all your request in a single collection and also save it in your account.
-- There is a Runner feature , which runs your entire collection and generates a result about pass and fail web service requests. You don't need to run individual web service request all time.

What do you dislike about Postman?
-- Back end code generated by the Postman is not accurate and easily executable in each case.
-- Some collection version confuses the user during import export of collection requests
-- Can not send multiple request at a single time.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
-- Great application for Web Service Request and Response check.
-- Very light application and and easy to use because of light UI design.
-- easily store all request in a single collection and share in JSON format.
-- Synchronization helps to recover all the saved collection each time when you switch to another machine.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
All Web Service requests like GET , POST , PUT , DELETE , OPTIONS  can easily be tracked  in postman.
-- I easily create a collection and put all related request in that and it is saved and synchronized in my account too.
-- The collection is easily be exported in JSON format and used in other system.
-- Accurate response with all details i get .

all_reviews.review_title: Best API testing tool of all time.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I am using postman for about 2 years for API development, mostly Rest API. and I have never been disappointed with it. This is the best tool available in the market. Best thing about is its simplicity and extensibility. You can use as desktop version or if in a hurry, you can directly use in chrome as plugin. Every step of my API development passes through postman. It helps me to validate and test my current development with its automated testing.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Sometimes postman monitors are run remotely and cannot access private services.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
If you want to start with automation testing of apis or want to do monitoring or you are a developer who wants a tool to validate API development work then postman is the best tool.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
We work to develop apis. Postman helps us complete life cycle of API development from development(use it as client) to testing to monitoring. I cannot imagine my life without postman. With postman we only have to think about development and testing and monitoring can be easily implemented using Postman.

all_reviews.review_title: Check small APIs for users
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman allows us to handle sophisticated web service management and specific payloads. It includes a good team communication feature too. If you use a trial version, it provides most compatibilities and support for future templates, headings, application bodies, etc. And if you use the paid edition, you can use it for security, so you can protect your user interface on the development API endpoint.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Postman fails to incorporate third party for logging and tracking, something that would be very nice to have. Also, Postman accepts mobile application monitoring only web browsers.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Postman is well suited for checking multiple APIs as it provides fast and broad handling capabilities for managing header and payloads correctly. It is best to use it as a product to reach the user experience. I would frankly recommend Postman for any development company working with any sort of API-based information and communication structure, although it is versatile enough for us to be used in less common situations, but simple enough to provide adjustments for the HTTP exchanges.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman is used by most developers of the IT department within our company. The environmental variability setup is a great time saver for us. I particularly like Postman to check small APIs for users, as it allows to evaluate APIs and internet services quickly and easily. It can be used for measuring endpoints positively or negatively, either for measuring their connectivity or for data transmission.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Is great for API developing because you can save global variables, save collections and share it with your team. Also it is great because you can save a request and instantly your team can see the changes. Also I like that I can know if I am formatting bad a JSON or if the header is right if I am using Content-Type: application/json, but if I want to use a Content-Type, it also give a sample of the structure and this is good to learn how to use it.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Is uses a lot of RAM when you have some tabs opened. Also, I would like if I could paste the raw headers in other formats. I would like if it can be automated, I don't know that it is possible, but if it is possible, would be great to show tips every day to learn something new. Also, when you send a long file in base64, it can take a long time.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
I recommend Postman because is really easy and fast to use and to share, you can copy and paste text in different codings without problem

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I can test my APIS whitout coding, I can save the body, parameters and headers of the requests and reuse it in a really easy way. I am using it to learn how to use some HTTP methods like POST or PUT that are difficult to use without coding

all_reviews.review_title: Postman for API checking
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman offers mock databases for your API. It is very easy to manage and the results are quite productive. It makes very simple  to write on other languages, as you can handle concise layouts of the integral webservice product life cycle. It enables everyone to quickly and effortlessly add or remove variables and display data in a well-formatted and readable way. It also helps you to save the details so you do not have to check again and again, by grouping demands and handling multiple requests. Postman offers different forms of payloads, such as JSON, and flexible HTTP headers and queries that are organized into lists, placed in databases or inserted into historical records.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I wish Postman could have more stronger structured records. Also, POstman can be pretty expensive for most small companies. Also, in comparison to the web version, the Chrome extension version is not brilliant.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Postman is a well suited tool for all those companies that want support in building dumb backends to their web service while focusing in the front end. Tests are simple to run and can be performed by anyone from everywhere.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Postman in the IT department for commercial development and API checking. It offers an easy, highly interactive REST server, so we can check many API datasets and monitor the tests of applications and payloads. This is also used for outside third party, when documents are submitted.

all_reviews.review_title: Best tool for API Testing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The ease of use while testing REST APIs. Customizable HTTP API requests and exporting them to multiple programming languages is super convenient while testing. The ability to save our work in workspace and organize them as collections help a lot in replaying or resuming an old testing session. Allows for collaboration between teams with the help of an invite option.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Honestly, it is a bit slow to start up at times and it can be frustrating when you are testing a crucial API endpoint. Also, the UI/UX! Scrolling sometimes hide the params in the request and it is not intuitive to realize it actually has those params you configured and impacts productivity.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Top quality API testing. Cant get any better than this!

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Mainly, API testing. When you have different microservices running in multiple containers, postman comes in handy to configure the HTTP API endpoints for each of them differently and helps you switch between contexts quickly and efficiently.

all_reviews.review_title: Build APIs and internet services with Postman
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is readily scalable, as it provides all choices for your API gateway checking and all possibilities for checking the API endpoint. Also, it includes automation checks to track the features and the quality of your APIs. Postman is very good to create, store, import and export the entire idea of collections. It's very user-friendly as well. Checking the API gateway with Postman is really quick and we can submit anything we wish for to check in case of mistake.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Postman may be a little confusing and cumbersome for new users, so you will need to take some time to practice. It may be frustrating to use the tabs on Postman as there are hundreds of tabs available and you may easily get confused. Also, it fails to integrate with 3rd party to track and submit reports.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Postman is suitable in ordinary or business settings for checking and improving cloud service. Also, it will work well if you have to switch the experiments in different settings and structures. However, I would not recommend using Postman as a programming device or an optimization system, because it is specially built for developmental research and monitoring.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman was deployed in the IT department of my company to build APIs and internet services on a daily basis. It is mainly handled by our group of software developers and a leading manager. It helps us to quickly develop a package and communicate our plans with many other team members.

all_reviews.review_title: Lightweight, simple to use platform for API calls
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is my go-to when I want to quickly test an API without having to go through a cumbersome web framework. I like how the params, headers and body are all specified in separate tabs so that you won't get them confused. The ability to view call history is also really nice.

What do you dislike about Postman?
It can be hard to get used to for novice web developers as it requires good knowledge of how HTTP requests and responses work. Has a lot of advanced settings and options that can quickly get confusing. Lacks a "beginner" UI for just the most simple functionalities.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Allows me to test APIs, both local and remote, when developing applications at work. This can greatly help with debugging.

all_reviews.review_title: Must have tool for api development
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a very essential tool for api development in backend. You can customize any input there is to an http request such as params, auth, headers, body, etc. And at the output you can check the response body, cookies and headers. At the body you can even specify an encoding or a raw input and select from JSON, TEXT, HTML, XML even Javascript. It offers a lot of flexibility. You can develop your own workspace or share with a team which all development needs today. I am not sure if it's only a mac feature, but I really like returning back to the sessions I did not even saved on application or OS reboot.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I cannot really see anything I dislike from this tool.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
For backend development, this is the first tool that I recommend, since you don't need to wait for the frontend to actually test your implementation. I also recommend it for testing APIs. It's free to download the app, or you can use the chrome plugin too.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Developing and testing backend API. It is a really flexible tool for development and testing API, I have not tried automated test yet but there is an option to do that too.

all_reviews.review_title: API Rest test and easy improvement
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
What I like most about working with postman is that when developing an API, you can easily test the requests you develop and share with the members of the development team, as well as adding examples of the requests for teams that are working in another part of the project, such as a web page or mobile application that will consume the API services accelerating the development process. It also has many features to test your API services such as the ability to chain requests and test response data.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Something that I really dislike about Postman is the way in which you have to send the arrays in the requests, if you have to send a very large array you will have to enter the elements of the same one by one in the form of a list by hand and things They get worse with multi-level arrays.
Sometimes my projects do not synchronize when I log in to other devices and something that I also dislike are the few interface customization options.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
For those who use Postman on remote devices it is good to add examples to your requests and document as best as possible to have a good understanding between the different parts of the team.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
With Postman it has been possible to detect errors in the structure of the requests and problems with the response data before releasing the final versions of the product.
We have also been able to replicate requests from third parties to learn how other companies do.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman is the test tool for developers and students
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman has the most important test methods that are POST, GET, VIEW, LOCK, UNLOCK and many more. The best thing is that it allows to store data of tests carried out. In addition, it has a simple user interface, so it is not necessary to be an advanced user to carry out a test. I also like to be able to customize the interface and change its color.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I do not like that Postman eliminates the API tests, because it is very easy to forget the URLs or what was requested, besides the body code. The history of the tests should always be maintained.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
I recommend the use of Postman for the development of API. It is a powerful tool and it will be very easy to use or learn to use. In addition, there is a lot of online documentation to guide you in your tests or developments.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
It is very easy to test my APIs developed in PHP to verify its correct functioning. I did not need technical knowledge to learn how to use this program, because the learning curve is very short. In addition, it also allows me to test APIs created in Java.

all_reviews.review_content:

What do you dislike about Postman?

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool to analyse APIs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a free tool, available for multiple platforms like Windows, Mac, Ubuntu, etc. Postman is very user friendly and simple to handle, with no extensive training required.
its main feature is the ability to perform API requests and validate the response. It enables define the type of request, add a body in several formats and add header parameters.
The history is very useful if we have forgotten to save a request or need to check some of the previous requests.
It also enables to save my API requests in collections and share them with all my computers and with my team in instantly. For this reason Postman is a great collaborative tool.
The collections can run all together and generate the results instead running each request individually.
This is very useful in API testing because it makes the task much easier.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Whereas Postman is an excellent tool for testing API, it would be great if this tool enables stress and load tests. But this is not the case. We can ru our collections multiples times in order to evaluate the system behavior under heavy loads.
Unfortunately, this tool can not generate execution reports. This reports are essencial in project management to show the work done.
Sometimes the synchronization across computers and team members have some issues. Code conflits, loss of data, ...
The integration with Jenkins works really bad.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
I recommend using Postman for the development and testing of APIs. It's a very powerful tool and very simple to use and learn. In addition, is a very known software, so there is a lot of online documentation and examples that can help to understand it.
It allows to store and share all the existing collections with multiple requests.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman is very simple to use and even a non-technical person can easily use this, as there is no need to coding  knowledge is required.
It's really easy to define automated tests for an API, and make it test our API frequently to assure that it is working as planned. Each request can be defined wit the type of the request, body and headers.
We can "spy" the API and validade if this is secure to use or if this is easily hackable.
It enables working simultaneously with a team.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
-- Postman is very helpful application to have Request and Response result for API verification.
-- shows very accurate result with complete response details each time
-- have collection support so that user can have record of similar API in single collection and can share to another machine.
-- supports import and export feature in JSON format.

What do you dislike about Postman?
-- Should support more code view converter framework. Also all generated code is not executable.
--  Not able to execute multiple API at the same time or interlinked API with single run
-- There should be a proper message details if there is no server found.
-- Swagger import is confusing User Interface after all API gets classified.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
-- Very easy to use if you are looking for a API request - response tool.
-- supports save and synchronization so that user can easily download all the previous request and response data on other device too.
-- Provides all most complete features with no cost.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
-- Sending Web service Request in various method support like GET, POST ,PUT, DELETE, OPTION helps to find all the related response in a ease way.
-- There is a good feature called Runner which runs the collection and generates the result of each passed and failed APIs so that no need to run all the similar APIs all the time manually.
-- Supports JSON format result structure so to easily be imported and tested on other system too.

all_reviews.review_title: The Ultimate Api Tester
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is the ultimate Api testing Tool. I have been using it for sometime now and there is no other tool that beats it. The tool provides you with the perfect environment for Api development and testing.
The robust features of the tool like saving Api collections, generating the collections from urls, saving the global variables etc. pave the way for a successful development and testing process.
It is a great collaborative tool as well. If you make any changes to the Api and save the request, it becomes instantly visible to your team.
It gives you the facility of checking the type of request you are sending or the content-type of the request, allows you to configure the request variables both from the body and the forms and a lot more.
One of the features of the tool that makes it stand out is the ability to chain request and test data during Api testing. This gives a whole new dimension to your process of Api handling.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Since the tool operates on such high complexity therefore it can sometime cause performance issues on a low end machine. this can make it a bit sluggish and slow.
Sending multidimensional arrays can also become problem as you have to manually enter each level despite it having the same structure.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
The tool is one of the best options out there. It takes your Api development and testing to you a new level. Try it and experience it all for yourself.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Currently I am using postman for Api development and testing. It works very well for back end development and testing. This also helps other members of the team to understand your work.

all_reviews.review_title: Quick API REST testing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I appreciate being able to test my APIs with ease and speed. Postman accepts the most common request methods and generates a response that apart from the usual Raw format, has the option to appear in a Pretty format, one more intelligible for the user.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Inside a Postman request I can build Headers or Keys that I may want to use in a different request, but Postman does not allow to copy these internal structures, forcing me to duplicate the whole request, move it to another folder, and then modify it accordingly, which all seems unnecessarily complicated.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
My primary goal has been testing the services of my own APIs and adjusting the front end of our web pages accordingly.

Postman also allows working on a project simultaneously with my colleagues and keeping track of versions through its file sharing feature.

all_reviews.review_title: Neat API development environment, a complete tool for developers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is one of the best options to build, test and debug APIs. It is super easy to use and comes with a huge amount of useful features and tools. It is really intuitive and you can test your APIs, allowing you to manage headers, build body requests and format the responses in several types (JSON, XML, etc.). Another of those features provides a tool for automated tests. You can also have private and shared workspaces, where you can collaborate in real time with coworkers.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I think that Postman has a lack of features related to test case monitoring. It provides it, but there are other platforms out there in the market that comes with best tools for this particular purpose.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Take advantage of the workspace / folders disposition to keep all your APIs organized. You should also try to test them using the provided tools for that. For me, it is the best APIs manager tool in the industry right now.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
APIs development and testing, and a shared workspace to save and test several APIs. It is clear to read and understand.

Postman is very interactive and reduces the amount of code you have to deal with. If you are familiar with the basic concepts surrounding API, then exploratory testing is very easy to do. Automated processes are also possible but these do require more experience.

Besides it has a really nice interface, with the option of having a black background in order to reduce the strain on your eyes, which is handy when you spend several hours testing the performance of APIs in development.

What do you dislike about Postman?

I have been using Postman to improve my company's web commerce front end, and making sure the data collection is done securely and efficiently. I have also come to realize that many websites don't secure their APIs, which is an interesting analysis made through Postman tools.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman: Easy to use HTTP client for developers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is one of the most used tools since a very long time for testing REST API framework effectively. The thing I like the most, that it also comes as Google Chrome extension, so I have not to install it separately. Also, there are different tab panels for different projects; because of that, I can work on APIs of many projects at a time. Even l can locally duplicate the API without affecting the main server itself. UI is very clean and initiative. Regarding performance, it is phenomenal and also, the synching feature of it provides consistency in changes which is most crucial.

What do you dislike about Postman?
There is some point for improvement such as SSL issue control can be provided to the user while testing API as well as for SOAP interface, more support is necessary nowadays. Other then that there are not any issues in postman I have never faced til this time.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Postman is indeed a great tool for REST API testing and debugging. It is a free tool and has a very minimal learning curve. Even a beginner can use it effortlessly.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use postman to get the request and response structure of specific API for mobile app version implementation. Also, I can modify and test API locally without concerning the Database developer.

all_reviews.review_title: Best tool for API developers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
1) It's easy to use
2) Best for testing purposes (Provides all the options required to test an API)
3) Good for collaborating with team mates
4) Helps save the history of the work that you've done using Postman
5) Can easily import collections for common requests across teams and test on different test environments

What do you dislike about Postman?
1) the UI can be difficult to use at first
2) Syncing the changes doesn't work as expected sometimes
3) The free version has limited options just enough for debugging

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
1) A good documentation with common examples would be great
2) The UX could be improved to help new users
3) The sync feature could be enhanced

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
1)  Testing APIs developed by the Product team
2)  Making simple requests like GET, POST and PUT
Benefits:
1) Postman helps understand the root cause if the error in code by returning the appropriate status codes
2) It helps collaborate across teams by allowing import and export options

all_reviews.review_title: Developer and tester tool for checking functionalilty of API.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Its a nice product for testing APIs . It also allows to save a collections of URLs, which can be utilized further. It also allows sharing of collection URLs across internet from local, so other people also have access to my collection at local.

What do you dislike about Postman?
well, it doesn't have much downside but one of the bad feature is whenever I edit a existing collection, it doesn't ask me to save the previous versions , it saves the latest data automatically.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Postman is very easy to understand and use. I recommend it if you want to test your API functionality. If you are at development phase ,it is very helpful to check API features. It is also very helpful when you want to test a API which is created by other team or other person.
There are some features which alone can't be tested by browser, You can add use to test security features of your API. you can provide authentication headers, along with type of request like get,put,post,delete. Along with these you can also provide request body of API to test it. When you get a complete response in output, you can debug your application on the basis of it.
I will rate postman as one of the developer best friend.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman is very helpful when you want to test your APIs.In the development phase , where there is no front end, its of great use to test backend functionality. UI is very simple to use and understand. Love the product.

* Nice interface
* Easy navigation and use compare to Paw for example
* Chrome extension
* i like that it shows all my recent activity on the left. if i need to use the same or similar end point, i can just search it there and select already existed one
* it has powerful api testing features

* not clear how to save different environments and use it that way. I saved different envs and they never worked as i expected. I guess i didn't understand how to use them clearly and all the time i had to keep separate tabs with Test, Dev and prod envs.
*can't be used for automates testing
* when the message appears about updated version on the top it never goes away
* sometimes it freezes and i need to restart

testing api end points

all_reviews.review_title: Postman Delivers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The ability to save your queries to quickly resend them are useful when testing large systems. But whats better - Postman has such a beautiful User Interface! It is clear, easy to navigate, and prioritises important functions. By taking all of the confusion out of navigating their interface, the team at Postman have given us a product that not only works flawlessly, but doesn't confuse us as users!

What do you dislike about Postman?
It might just be me, but Postman seems to run with an abnormally high RAM usage for such a small application, especially when idle in the background. Aside from that, the limit on the number of free calls seems like a lot (1000), until you use it up, which I have done on occasion when building APIs.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Get it. Postman doesn't disappoint. And its free! Whats not to love?

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman allows easy testing of APIs, either to test functionality of an API you plan on using, or to test one that you are building yourself. Having the ability to quickly and easily send and receive messages, and inspect them also, has been a game changer. I have saved so much time by quickly spinning up Postman to verify if something is working as expected. Postman doesn't disappoint!

all_reviews.review_title: Postman
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a very easy to use and lightweight tool for APIs. We are using this for API testing. Its has programming features which allows to write code to generate values in Pre Requisite or Test scripts. It also has Global or environment variables concept which is handy.

We can create test cases with validations and can schedule the execution using Runner. The free version of Postman itself is sufficient for small teams.

Postman's Newman plugin is used for command line integration and it helps to integrate with automation tools.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The free version allows only few number of API requests for a team. Newman can make it more easier to implement and use

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
If you are looking for a simple and powerful tool for API testing, then this is the perfect tool for you.

Postman made API testing very simple and easy

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is very simple and easy to use, Sections for all HTTP components are neatly defined. It allows to test all different HTTP methods. Authorization section supports multiple auth types allowed.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I dislike that Postman covers most of the screen spaces, space where output gets displayed is very small especially when using laptops.
We cannot invoke multiple web services in parallel in Postman.

I use Postman to test REST End points. Postman collection helps to share end points used between developers.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
It is extremely easy to use and allows you to share test cases from one system to other systems or environments. The creation of test suites is equally simple and you can manage collections of test cases for integrations. It allows to store data from previous test cases in global variables and can be used as environment variables for calls between two APIs.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The plugin for Google Chrome has given me failures, so I recommend the installation of the desktop version, it is much more stable and well optimized.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
I love Postman and it seems to me a very important tool for those developers who do integrations with other systems or are backend and frontend programmers. I have also found it very useful to test the APIs that connect to mobile applications. Highly recommended.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman is the preferred tool in my job as a programmer. It has allowed me to make integrations with other systems very quickly and make tests very easily.

all_reviews.review_title: Simple interface to store and use APIs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is refreshingly easy to use for anyone - developers, engineering managers, product managers, customer support. Its one of the products that make you wonder how things happened before they were around.
.
I like the clean interface, ability to organise APIs in collections and share with the team and flexibility to change parameters in calling APIs quickly. There is a test automation feature also available but I have never been able to make good use of it.

What do you dislike about Postman?
There is very little to dislike in Postman. I would love to use some sort of test automation, where I can run all APIs in a collection at once and compare the results against expected outputs. I believe something on those lines already exists but have never been able to use it.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Just go for it, especially if you are trying the free version.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman helped to quickly test APIs of my product. I could also organise APIs in collections which enabled me to share them with development team.

all_reviews.review_title: It is the best tool to provide API development environement
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The best thing I like about postman is that it is fast, easier and we can send requests to verify that our API is ready to launch. It also helps to create a beautiful documentation. We can monitor APIs, document and debug them.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I dislike one thing about Postman i.e it deletes the API history after some days. Memory wise it is good but sometimes we tend to forget the API routes or what parameters were passed while calling that API then this feature proves to be a bottleneck.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Postman is a great API development tool. If you are comfortable with curl requests you can automatically the CURL request by clicking on the code button and run it in the terminal.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Mostly API development and its management is done using Postman. There are many benefits for eg you can directly take the CURL request code from the postman by clicking on the Code button and run it in terminal. Moreover there's an invite option where you can collaborate with your colleagues on the same API.

Storing API in one place, defining the variables to test on different environments (LOCAL, DEV, STAGING, LIVE), running a collection of API calls.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman - The best tool for testing APIs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is the best tool for testing APIs. If you are using APIs in your project, Postman is a tool you can not avoid. Because it very difficult to find errors in an API call. The best solution is to use Postman  to send an API call and you get the response . If there is some error, you can easily identify and correct it.Also you can test any no. of functions and it will be stored in your history.So after any changes, you can easily test your code using postman.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I am really satisfied with this product. But the dashboard can be little more user friendly. But overall I like the product.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Postman is the best option for testing APIs. I recommend this product for all developers who use API calls in their project.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have been using this product for the last 2 years. For me most difficult task in developing API calls was not able to identify the errors. Postman solved this issue.Now I could easily test my API calls. So it is very easy to create or edit an API call. This product saved lot of my time.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman the best man for post
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Tabs, workdpsaces and history. Rather your are going to use it for one time endpoint or everyday use to test your API, I love the fact that you can create workspace for particulars uses, like personal , business, or even specific project. The environment? Awesome, I don't have to worry about typing credentials, urls everytime I want to change from dev to test. And it's sync with all my computers!

What do you dislike about Postman?
To be honest, there's nothing so far that I dislike, on my experience maybe with this tests documentation, sometimes I loose myself in how to get a field from a response and set a variable, but I think I have to take more than 1 minute to read about it :)

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
You are gonna love it. That's it. Use it for a week, and trust me your are going to use it always regardless of your role, developer, admin, devOps, QA, manager. You can share the project (list of requests, with vars, fields, headers).

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
We handle 3 + 1 environments for a product (dev,test,prod + local dev) and changing the environment from a list, awesome!

all_reviews.review_title: The best API development software
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
When I am beginner regarding API topic, I started with Postman software. I generally use only one API which is I am learning but later on studying this software leads me to analyse and getting knowledge of more APIs of different sections. Regarding this software I the most like is it's friendly touch. Any beginner developer who is new in API development field can easily get all the features. Apart from UI, it's theme, workspace, different tools all are the best among any other API development software.

What do you dislike about Postman?
One of the thing which I dislike is it's policy of updating software. Earlier I am happy customer of for this application but from recent nowadays, some of the APIs are there which are famous in e-commerce market that are not provided by this software. Also another point is for some of API, when I am trying to get response from that API,  that app through unusual errors. Initially I thought that issue is from my side, but later on came to know from web surfing, there are some of the bugs which are causing uncertain error.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
If you want to do anything with API then postman is right platform for you. If you are new in this field then I must suggest to use this app.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
In business, via  this software we are calling different API's and try to understand responses from different API's. After getting responses, we are managing those data to build code and allow different features to work perfectly.  After using this I realise that how easy to learn and work with API. Before using this app, I am afraid of Api but now this one is most likely part in my coding life.

A good tool for testing APIs, by sending request to the web server and getting back the response. This is being used as a mainstream tool
It allows you to share and move test cases from one system to another system and environments. It helps in importing testcases /apis using import features like raw etc
Integration features like jenkins .
It allows you to store data from previous test cases into global variables using javascript. These variables can be used like environment variables for API calls between two APIs.

Only javascript is supported to creating global variables and passing the values at run time .

Making testsuites and used for debugging the apis.

all_reviews.review_title: A great testing tool for testing APIs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The best thing about postman is that it can easily be integrated with multiple different tools like Jenkins. This makes the work of a developer very easy and fine. The other good thing about this is that it has the ability to share and move test cases from one system to another system and also to different environments. This makes managing the test cases extremely easy. Within postman, it is very easy to create test suites.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Even when on the paid license the cloud service is not very optimal. The cloud keeps on messing some of my collections when synchronizing. Like with some of my duplicates and deletions it doesn't sync very well. During the integration testing, sometimes I just end up duplicating lots of code and not knowing what to do with it.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Very recommended for the software developers.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
POstman tool is very stable and helps you do what it is supposed to do. It is a great design for people working on it and fixing bugs for the APIs. The packaged app version provided by postman has some additional capabilities and includes features such as OAuth 2.0 support and bulk uploading/importing which are very advance.

all_reviews.review_title: My experience testing APIS with postman
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I like postman because is very lightweight tool, very easy to use and UI friendly. Also i am able to share collections with members of my team easily. The Monitor feature is very useful because allows polling requests to any endpoint and make assertions/validations scripts, recieving notifications to email if it fails.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The Monitor feature mentioned above, is kinda limited with free version for my general purposes. It limits number of requests in spite of you can pay for more requests if you need.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
I recommend Postman if you need ease of use and a light tool, but especially if you need to share the collections with your team. However, if you need to use the Monitor feature, be sure you know the limitations of free version and the costs if you want to increase the number of requests.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm able to design collections to test APIs, avoiding bugs and improving quality of software and customer satisfaction and share this collections to be executed by any member of my team in a easily way.

all_reviews.review_title: Using Postman for over 3 years now in the project
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The best tool to test the REST API's or any service hosted on any server using HTTP protocol for communication. The JSON request can be sent across to test a new service you developed or an existing service provided by some other application provider. You can group the request into a postman collection and share that across as well and others can import it. You can also use postman runner which will automatically execute the requests which is a very good feature.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The chrome extension of postman was discontinued which was a very good feature for postman. It was really easy to use this as there was no need of installation of any software to run postman. Now you will have install the postman server and then use it.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
If you have just started to work on REST API's then Postman is the best tool you can use to test your service you have just developed. It is very easy to use and understand. You can store your postman requests used for testing as postman collections and share it across to other users as well.
Overall very great tool.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using postman extensively in our project to test REST API's and are continuing to use it on a daily basis. We have used it in our Order management project to test and REST API's provided by the OMS system into our ESB layer. We use it check these API's if there are any orders which are stuck in any pending status.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Tool to create/test API
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I was introduced to POSTMAN back in college. I used it to send POST and GET requests.It was a great tool to get API data and receive the output in a variety of formats like JSON or XML. But the best feature I used was when I started my first job and I used it to build a mock API for an app. It helped me create mock API callouts which could be shared across with your team without worrying about having an actual backend.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I had to read a lot of tutorials on how to create mock API requests and how to save the response. The tutorials provided don't go in depth on each use case. A better walkthrough of all the features would really make it easy to use.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
It helped me create dummy backends for my web app without having to worry about having an actual backend while working on my front-end. Helps in creating API structures by allowing us to save responses for a callout request.

all_reviews.review_title: A must for would be API Librarians
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Easy to use yet powerful provided you can code a bit.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Can't access databases (or at least I have not found a way).

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Make extensive use of yourself an easy life and treat it like a library or catalogue of API requests.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Documenting and testing APIs is a matter of organisation, and Postman makes it very easy to organise API tests into logical suites (collections). I call myself an API Librarian rather than a tester because to me the greatest aspect of Postman is the ability to organise requests.

When it comes to repetitive coded test elements, like setting a valid future date or calculating and expected value, Postman offers very powerful variable options at a local and global level.

We are writing Javascript to provide additional functionality, which could become a maintenance headache, but in Postman you can load the Javascript into a variable and simply call the function you need into the individual tests.

Using Newman we integrate the Postman collection tests into our CI environment, running automatically at every build and deployment. This works with Jenkins, Bamboo and GoCD (and similar tools).

And finally because the tests are easy to understand our non-technical stakeholders can get involved. I only wish I could write tests that go to check the contents of databases (like Couchbase or MongoDB as well as SQL databases) from within Postman.

We are writing Javascript to provide additional functionality, which could become a maintenance headache, but in Postman you can load the Javascript into a variable and simply call the function you need into the individual tests.

Using Newman we integrate the Postman collection tests into our CI environment, running automatically at every build and deployment. This works with Jenkins, Bamboo and GoCD (and similar tools).

And finally because the tests are easy to understand our non-technical stakeholders can get involved. I only wish I could write tests that go to check the contents of databases (like Couchbase or MongoDB as well as SQL databases) from within Postman.

all_reviews.review_title: The simplest tool for testing and designing API requests
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Simple and easy to use and organize your work. I always test my API calls in Postman before implementing them in code or other places - you can clearly see what works and what doesn't, re-use previous work, convert your configuration to code, authenticate with all common methods...

What do you dislike about Postman?
Nothing! I love Postman!
Really - nothing I can think of.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
When working with APIs (mostly for setting up integrations between our internal tools, or to troubleshoot our own API), POstman allows me to easily create, re-use, tweak, and save API calls. It makes it easy to figure out the right call before implementing it elsewhere.

There are so many advantages of Postman over other API tools.
1. Send each type of requests is easy.
2. Setting headers, params, body is a hassle-free job.
3. Saving requests help you reusing them in future.
4. Creating test suits is simple.
5. It can easily integrate with external tools like Jenkins.
6. The application is compatible with almost all systems.

What do you dislike about Postman?
1. Monitoring of test cases is a bad experience.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
This is the best API testing tool in the market. I would recommend it to every developer.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Being a graduate student in Software Engineering, I develop web applications. When we develop the back end, Postman is a great API testing tool.
