all_reviews.review_title: A lightweight tool for all your API needs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I have only good things to say about postman. It gives a super rich yet lightweight developer experience. We can create advance test frameworks and seamless team collaboration. It is stable and does exactly it has to do.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Though it very user friendly yet it requires a high degree of technical knowledge. A person without knowing much about APIs can not just go and check whether the API is working or not. They should be in a position to understand how GET, POST and various other methods work.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
It is been a while since I last used postman. But we have used to test the JSON-REST based Web Services with this, it makes the process pretty amazing. And it made the whole RPA process a lot more easier to test our APIs. We have also written custom Java codes which would be interacting with different systems using JSON payload and postman made it quite easy to analyse those huge JSON objects with ease.

all_reviews.review_title: Essential for consuming APIs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I like the easy that becomes to test almost any kind of service, only by configuring some parameters and, if needed, the environment. The possibility to store and organize your requests by collections and folders is very useful too, joined to the different environments that you can configure (i.e. to test both DEV and PROD endpoints). And now, with the "workspaces" added recently you can share your collections even easily that before..
I maintain it always open in my computer, because I know I will use it several times per day

What do you dislike about Postman?
Maybe that you have to pay for several options and it would be great if it support SOAP services.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Get the PRO account

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I develop REST APIs that I have to test and call from the web (which I also develop) and Postmen let me to directly make the request I exactly want to test, without the need to navigate through the web to reach the button/form/link that also makes the call.

all_reviews.review_title: Makes API work much easier
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman makes a lot of the nitty-gritty work out of API creation/testing much easier. Being able to save requests and parameters aids a lot in iterating over different calls or creating different versions of an API. Sharing calls among teammates is super helpful as well.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The UI could use a little work and doesn't seem to have been updated in a while. It's a little hard to figure out where everything is when you first start using it. There are several levels of nesting requests and projects, and tabs on multiple sides that makes it easy to lose what you were working on

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
It's probably not the slickest or easiest to use tool, but it's a huge improvement over issuing curl commands for testing. And it's cheap

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman makes it much easier to test out API calls and keep track of the work you're doing. Lets you focus on the logic of the calls and the structure of them, rather than having to remember labyrinthine curl commands

all_reviews.review_title: The most used software at work
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Very easy to save and manage API calls. Lot of great features to make lives of API developers easy. This is one tool every API developer must have. It is more powerful and easy to use compared to some of its competitors .  It rolls out upgraded versions pretty often and usually new and good features are added. Lot of information about the information is made available to the users, including cookies.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Probably when it was new, it was a bit hard to save and maintain requests for multiple environments, but now this is not the case. Saving or cloning can sometimes be a problem.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
A Must have tool for any API developer or tester. Definitely needs to be tried.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
This is used to test API calls while developing or used by quality engineers to test various API calls. It is used to test our APIs on multiple environments, including our local boxes.

all_reviews.review_title: A great API management software
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a complete software, it handles every kind of HTTP requests, it support cookies, and is very organized. You can divide your APIs in folders (projects), and you can also set environment variables, so that you can easily switch to testing/development environments. You can also visualize the response in different syntaxes (HTML, XML, JSON etc).

What do you dislike about Postman?
I still have to try each feature, since I focused on registering each API, but as of now, I found Postman to be very complete and functional. I've had no issues or crashes while using the software, it is always very stable.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
It has many features and the documentation publishing is very well done

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed to store the APIs for a new project, to keep track of them and test our app functionalities and response. We also had to publish a documentation for our programmers.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Pros:
The ability to set up global variables to be used across APIs.
Collection and Team workspaces are great for collaboration.
The tool is fast.

What do you dislike about Postman?
There is no option for sorting or color customization. When we work with multiple collections of microservices, color coding will help to quickly find out the APIs.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
If you are going to work on microservices with lot of team colloboration, the free version may not suit you - Go Pro.
There is a limitation on the collections you can share in the free version of postman.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Postman for  REST API testing .

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is simple, easy to use and extremely reliable. It has a simple user interface. I like that it can automatically save calls made so that I can reuse them as needed. The ability to open multiple tabs is very useful.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Ability to create/save variable names is difficult. In fact, discoverability of it is even harder. For e.g. I want to give a user friendly name for my different test servers like [DB-Server URL], [AppServer URL], [QABox], [Jenkins-Box], etc. It is somewhat hard to find how and where I can do this.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
API testing for product development and testing.

all_reviews.review_title: A great endpoint API manager
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a great API manager, it allows you to test your API calls and publish a documentation for other to use your endpoint calls. It has many helpful features, the one I like most is variables. You can create environments presets, composed of variables, that you can use anywhere in your APIs. In the URL, header parameters, request body etc. They are very useful, and allow you to quickly switch between testing and production environment.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The interface is not always clear (e.g. I use two columns layout and sometimes texts are chopped off). Also if you click and drag on the header parameters to select text, it will select the parameters instead, causing some problems the first time I tried to edit them

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Postman is a great software for API test and management. It is fast and reliable, with lots of features to test your API in every scenario case (different options, content language etc)

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman helped us creating and publishing our APIs, we were looking for a product that could help us doing so, and Postman had all the features we were looking for

all_reviews.review_title: Great API Tool, always improving
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
This is an important spanner in the startup developer toolkit. They have added a lot of functionality over the last 3 years since we started using it and Postman proved useful enough that it was the first dev tool we paid for - and we were stingy back then.

The ability to create collections, put in multiple example requests+responses for each API and share them with the team is now a core part of our dev workflow.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The user interface could be dramatically better. The ability to share environments, templates, collections is confusing - it can be done from a few different places and the user interface isn't really conducive to building muscle memory of where to access which functionality.

Anytime I need to touch anything sharing/un-sharing related, I know I am going to click in a few different places before I get to what I really want to do.

The Collections cannot be ordered in the sidebar based on user's needs - and only supports automatic alpha sorting. Staring/unstaring collections also mysteriously reorders the collections. So good luck organizing them.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
As a startup, communicating APIs through documentation - code or otherwise - is expensive and error prone - and frankly we don't have the time for it at the pace at which we move. It is much more preferable to have the API developers test using Postman and then progress those tests- and the variations of those tests into collections of API calls that serve as documentation of those service end points.

Postman has the ability to save snapshots of API calls for a given call - which serves the client developers well in that they are able to see the various ways to call the API, the error codes supported etc. Also since these collections can be published, it is great as API documentation.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is a must robust tool for web developers. It gives them easy way to test api calls or basically any HTTP request. Postman, provides natives apps for every operating system, for free. The advanced import feature, the saving requests ability, along with the cloud sync feature make Postman one of a kind. For more advanced users, Postman offers subscription bases collaboration.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I can't think of something i dislike. Maybe the fact that the UI can be a little overwhelming at first can be counted as a flaw.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
If you're looking for an app to help you make HTTP requests you should try Postman, because it's free and it works great. It has every tool you need, whether you need simple or advanced requests.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
When building an api or a client, it's important to be able to test and store every request. Postman makes this process easy, by providing us the tools we need to debug and generate code.

all_reviews.review_title: Intuitive and powerful tool for API development and use.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Easy to save custom collections, and share between team members.  You can use shared workspaces, or export as JSON, and import.

The JSON export format is easy to understand and documented.  I was able to have my code auto-generate a postman collection to share with testers and development teams.

Supports saved environments and templates request strings, parameters, and headers.  This makes it really easy to jump between different environments when testing the same API in QA or Prod.

What do you dislike about Postman?
It is VERY slow to process payloads over a few MB in size.  A response of any size over 5 MB makes the response section chug.  Downloading large files is also slow.  Luckily there is a feature to turn your saved request into a cURL command which I just run from the terminal.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
The free version is awesome as it is.  The shared workspaces are really nice when working with a team, but you'll need the Pro version.  Worth it in my opinion.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Documentation and low level UI for our REST APIs.

This is the tool which is used for testers and developers also. It has a very friendly GUI which makes us easy to construct requests and to read the responses. We can select the different HTTP methods we want such as GET,Post and Put methods easily. We can document API's faster in this tool. It also offers some add-on packages which are called jetpacks.

What do you dislike about Postman?
There are no major problems with the postman. It would be better if the UI is made little more simpler. This tool can be installed only on chrome. If you need to install the postman, firstly you have to install the google chrome, because it is available as a chrome extension for the Windows, Mac and Linux.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
This tool is the best tool when it comes to the testing API's. I would strongly recommend to my colleagues to use this tool. It works with the JSON data very well. Creating the API's is not an easy task, but this tool made this process easier. It is free of cost, can be installed easily. It can be used for the Automation testing, but it can helps for automation, such as debugging. It can be added as the chrome plugin.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
The best feature of this tool is it automatically saves the API calls which we have used in the past, which saves a lot of time when we are testing the API's. It is easy to create the request, the responses we received can be viewed in raw form or pretty forms.

all_reviews.review_title: Fantastic API Testing environment
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman's design is very intuitive and impressively supportive: cookies, custom headers, diverse POST data methods.
Lets you set defaults by environment, capable of auto creating documentation, able to simulate a mock server, and even capable of performing automated tests.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Sub folder architecture is less robust than the root folders; for example, we can only auto-create API documentation for everything in a root folder, not just for one sub-folder in a root folder.
Unable to send multiple TYPES of POST data. For example, I can't send a file as form-data AND JSON key:values as url-encoded.
The default key:value input for "x-www-form-urlencoded" doesn't support nested JSON/key:values

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Postman allows us to quickly and efficiently test our API responses speeding up sanity checks, response, and error handling.
It may not be a substitute for unit testing, but highly effective at testing quick calls, suites, or production issues without much overhead.

all_reviews.review_title: Very good REST Api client for developers. Easy to use interface. Fast, secure and easy to use.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Must have if you are developing web applications. It's free, a lot of documentation is available. Most widely used REST api client. Feature packed and uses native HTTP protocols. It integrates very well with google chrome and a lot of youtube videos are available to learn its usage. Most HTTP methods are covered and support the latest version of http as well

What do you dislike about Postman?
Nothing. Its open source software with easy to use, self-explanatory UI so cannot complain much. It's an industry standard software. It's a no-brainer.

The native app does not live up to the chrome extension standards.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Integrate SOAP UI and Kerberos support. fully-fledged android and windows app.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
API testing. Automation, security penetration testing. Development of web apps.

Postman can also be used to test SOAP services, but not as easy as REST services. This is something to improve for Postman.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:

Easy to create requests, you can generate code snippets for others programming languages and it has a free option.

The interface can be overwhelming in the beginning, how Postman handles certificates could be improved, and the import feature can be clunky sometimes, but these things don't make Postman unreliable.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The fact that you can not save multiple login credentials.

I would also improve the GUI so that the different parts (request/response) of the requests are more easily distinguishable.

all_reviews.review_title: Simple to use, powerful tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The tool is easy to use and quick to get used to. There are many options, and if you have any knowledge about how REST APIs work you can quickly understand all of the functions it offers.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The functionality to save and recall settings/API calls is REALLY not intuitive. The function exists, but as far as I can tell, you can only do it as a "library" or "collection". Also, when the program updates, sometimes the API settings you have been using will all be lost.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
This tool helps us immensely when trying to use third party REST APIs. We are able to quickly test connectivity, validate responses, and figure out implementation details.

all_reviews.review_title: Can't believe it's free!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Postman is amazing! It simplifies API development by consolidating all my API calls into one location. Additionally, using Postman Pro allows me to share my work with the rest of the my team. The variables allow me to quickly swap out my API parameters quickly and efficiently. The API testing feature allows me to create unit tests for each of my company's API calls. Last, the interface is friendly and easy to use.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The API testing framework needs to be expanded a bit. Right now, I can test one API call at a time with their testing feature. It would be nice to be able to create tests that would allow me to incorporate the results of other API calls.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Postman is the best API development tool I've encountered. I doubt you will find one better.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
At my company, we use Postman to develop our customer-facing API, as well as our internal API. We subscribe to the Postman Pro service, as well, which allows us to share our API library across the company.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Postman?
review_question_answers.answer: Postman is amazing! It simplifies API development by consolidating all my API calls into one location. Additionally, using Postman Pro allows me to share my work with the rest of the my team. The variables allow me to quickly swap out my API parameters quickly and efficiently. The API testing feature allows me to create unit tests for each of my company's API calls. Last, the interface is friendly and easy to use.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Postman?
review_question_answers.answer: The API testing framework needs to be expanded a bit. Right now, I can test one API call at a time with their testing feature. It would be nice to be able to create tests that would allow me to incorporate the results of other API calls.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Postman:
review_question_answers.answer: Postman is the best API development tool I've encountered. I doubt you will find one better.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: At my company, we use Postman to develop our customer-facing API, as well as our internal API. We subscribe to the Postman Pro service, as well, which allows us to share our API library across the company.

all_reviews.review_title: Cannot live without Postman for my work!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
#1 it is free.
#2 I love the fact that I can test pretty much any API in almost any configuration and get an immediate and correct response.
#3 I can create test payloads with ease and clone/copy my tests into folders for easy sorting and organization
#4 I can send payloads in any format needed (form posts, gets, raw text, json, etc).  I can literally recreate any submission type I need.
#5 Once I have the payload sorted out, I can export into any processing format I may need: AJAX/JS, C#, Node/JS, etc.
#5 I can retrieve payload responses and then export those into any format I may need: JSON, XML, plain text, etc.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Believe it or not the biggest issue I have is actually just creating a new "test" inside a Collection.  The UI is terrible in that regard.  I usually end up duplicating from another collection, sort of blank it out , and then start from there.  Maybe I'm not doing something right here but the UI is not clear for me.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
I don't know if it is possible but can you make it an option to share or forward an individual test to another user?  I see you can export entire Collections but sometimes I don't need quite that much.  This would be really nice to have as I work with other developers where I have to export or take screenshots of the tests I'm building local.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Being able to quickly test and debug third-party vendor APIs.  This has two benefits 1.) we can hold third-party vendors accountable and immediately put them to work fixing any issues in their services 2.) we can quickly pass payloads of any shape or size to quickly get metrics on the APIs we are testing

the tabbed structure makes saving changes and properties around different calls in your collection a little bit confusing at times.

we have many API's and we use postman to test against them

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
I like that you can create and save collections. It makes testing different APIs very efficient, without having to use curl or something similar that requires more work. It also allows you to save environment and global variables to make passing around different values really easy. The UI is pretty nice and simple.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Sometimes it can be really laggy. For example, when I am requesting a gatekeeper token, it takes a long time and the UI is pretty glitchy for that specific task.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I can test APIs that either I or other developers I'm working with have written. I can see what responses you get back from making certain calls.

all_reviews.review_title: Best Api Test Client
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Apart from basic stuff that postman does, I really like the collections and sharing feature.
You can even create your scripts and execute them using the runner feature.
I has all that you need to work in a collaborative development environment: support for envs, templates, Team collections etc

What do you dislike about Postman?
While its so good,  the user interface could be little more intuitive.  Also, since they already have collections, it would be cool to provide an abstraction to save and see api documentation like positive case response so that developer can easily check responses and validate, more like in an api documentation. All of this will be mostly a feature request.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Explore it completely, it has features which go unnoticed most of the times. For e.g. we did not know about the Test scripts that we could write for months.
Its a really useful tool for team collaboration and iterative development.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use it majorly for api testing, storing a handy collection of suites to work as a mini regression on the api.
Every developer is shared a team collection for most of the common api's to help him test new features.
API Documentation partially.

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool for testing web services
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
How easy to add security and parameters to web requests. Great tool for any web developer.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Older versions seemed to send requests from my machine, but later versions now seem to bounce Postman servers (or at least are unable to work behind corporate firewalls)

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Testing web services and endpoints that are REST

all_reviews.review_title: Absolute WebServices control
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The possibility to create collections and environment variables so it is not needed to change all the time the connectivity parameters working with different environments. Easy to introduce headers and body in different formats depending on your needs and input data.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The learning curve is a bit complicated when you try to use the tests functionality and other non-basic features

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Learn to use all the functionalities of the application since the potential is really high. Get some time to know what can you do with it, it will be well invested time.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Testing the REST WebServices I need to use before implementing them on my application.

all_reviews.review_title: API Testing tool one of its kind
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Best things in postman

1. Sign up/in feature available for saving the test data
2. Can add certificate for testing https apis
3. Collection (group multiple requests together)
4. Sharing feature
5. History of previous requests
6. Interactive user interface(UI)

and much more....

What do you dislike about Postman?
nothing to dislike apart from it hangs sometimes if a very long response is present for some api

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
Previously Android or iOS developer used to blame server APIs for incorrect responses. But now all API are tested throughly before integration. It reduced final development time as testing was done in parallel.

all_reviews.review_title: A great API tool!!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
It allows you to test the API web services you are working on in a test or prod environment. You can send headers and a request body. You also are able to choose what type of HTTP calls to make. Its also great for testing if a service is up and running.

What do you dislike about Postman?
It takes a while to get used to writing the code for automated testing. But once you learn it, its very easy to use. Not the best if you need certificates installed.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Use it, it's free!!

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
testing web service APIs

Postman makes it easy for even non-developers to test url's when creating or testing APIs.  It is the main tool I use for testing.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Not the most intuitive user interface but there is a lot of help available until you get used to it.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have several vendors who have setup comprehensive APIs to share and update information remotely.  We use postman to test APIs before moving into production within our regular programs.

all_reviews.review_title: Free & Easy - What's not to love?!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Great way for non-developers to send request, fetch data,  and get answers without bothering engineers.

What do you dislike about Postman?
It can be dangerous to send data, it's so easy to post to a database. When you hit 'Send', it's out in the world.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Go slow and make sure everything looks good before you 'Send'.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use it to check the balance of dozens of account in once place. I can also check the status of orders with outside vendors with a simple request.

all_reviews.review_title: Simple but could still improve
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
Easy to use and friendly UI. Can save collections and import/export them. Good for beginners as well as advanced users. Good for test runs as well.

What do you dislike about Postman?
I usually have trouble deleting items inside a  collection. They keep appearing again. Even though syncing is on, when I use it on my laptop v/s computer it just overrides and brings everything back. That can be improved or fixed.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
API testing and sharing collection across team members.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman for testing endpoints
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The ability to create "collections" of requests allow me to easily keep different projects and development tests separate from one another. You can also export these collections so they are easy to share with other users.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Some aspects of the UI are a little odd at first but you soon get used to them with frequent use.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
If you are looking for a quick way to test multiple web requests, with the ability to save those tests in collections for later use then Postman is a great choice.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
When developing connections to external APIs I am able to very quickly and easily generate and test a whole range of requests before implementing them into a fully fledged solution.

What do you dislike about Postman?
When there is a big array of data, If there was a place to make it short and and understand how many objects are there in the array. To check the issues with the JSON response data this is little difficult. I use a online tool http://www.jsoneditoronline.org/ to verify the JSON. If this tool would have been integrated with the POSTMAN, then it would have awesome.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:

I am nodeJS developer so I use this only for API development.
I also use this tool to test the performance of the API (Response Time)
I also use this tool to check third party API's, When we have to integrate with our Application.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman - great tool for exploring RESTful API
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
It is one of the best tools for API testing . Postman makes it easy to test, develop and document APIs, It has a very good interface. The request screen and response screen are well detailed and use can send all type of HTTP requests with authorisations,headers etc. You can save requests which are related to a particular project as collection and even share it with your co-developers. Postman keeps a history of your HTTP requests which comes in very handy.It's free and available as both chrome packaged app and as an extension and works on all OS that runs Chrome.It is very fast and moreover you can create environments for development,testing etc.

What do you dislike about Postman?
You cannot make socket calls from postman which I think maybe considered as a lacking feature. Many features are not available for free.There are some issues with postman extension on chrome but apart from that it is a very good tool to use .

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Postman has been a very useful tool and has made working with REST APIs very easy. It has many useful features such as collections, history of requests. It allows you to make all type of HTTP request which all type of request bodies, authentications etc.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have been using postman to manage my REST APIs . It has made testing and verifying APIs very easy and helps a lot in debugging too(i.e when there may be a problem with the request you are sending or response, status code etc.) Ability to make and share collections and recorded history of requests made are of immense help.

all_reviews.review_title: Essential API Development Tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The ability to create multiple environments and utilize variables within those environments that you can use to specify things like URLs or authorization tokens. This makes is easy to test you APIs across all the environments, without having to create separate collections for each. I also love the runner, which goes hand in hand with the ability to create tests and quickly regression test changes to your API.

I haven't used it yet, but the generate code feature is awesome as well, and will save a ton of time in the future.

What do you dislike about Postman?
This is a minor niggle, and probably just a symptom of it being a chrome addin and not a complete application, but if you make a change to one of your connections and then close the window without saving, it doesn't ask you to save.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Take the time to learn about the environments and environment variables ahead of time, so that you don't have to re-write your connections later.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
It allowed me to quickly respond to issues with my API across all of my environments, and quickly regression test changes that I made throughout the development process.

all_reviews.review_title: Get's the work done
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
The best I like about Postman are,

- Simple to use interface
- Postman Collections that can be exported or imported which makes it very easy to share your API
- I like sync but don't use it as much
- Postman environment variables is really nice especially when sharing your collections with others
- Request history has many times helped me in debugging current request
- Response preview feature is really nice

What do you dislike about Postman?
The things I dislike about Postman are,

- Postman app performance is slow since it's a packaged webapp and native apps tend be faster
- Cluttered UI which makes it hard to look for what you need
- Updates take a really long time since they download the complete new version everytime we want to update
- Postman data format is inconsistent and has breaking changes with versions
- Response truncating is a nice to have

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use Postman to build read-only APIs for my data portal and Postman was able to help me in quickly testing if everything is working as expected. Postman has done a good job in getting my work done.

all_reviews.review_title: REST Client for Chrome Browser
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
One can create new requests easily(you can check buttons for everything like authentication, get, push, add aparms etc), can maintain the history of requests, can import collections easily. One can build, test and validate APIs fast.

What do you dislike about Postman?
So far, there is nothing I disliked about postman. After facing so many issues in testing REST APIs, Postman saved our day.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
It is quite easy to use for building and testing REST APIs. Comes as plugin with Chrome browser.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using postman to GET test data from REST APIs of Success Factor. Simply selecting the GET/POST along with url and credentials will returns requested records within a few seconds depending on size of response. One can store/save the url to be used in future instead of wasting time in forming the same request again and again. Also, one can import/export collections easily.

all_reviews.review_title: Great for basic Rest API testing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
It's extremely easy to save request sessions to to test API's and keep track of what you've done with services so far. It's easier to use than Fiddler.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The Chrome extension adds headers automatically, unlike Fiddler. This may make you wonder why the API call is returning 200OK instead of a 4xx response, since you didn't add the content header explicitly in the request. Also, there's no way to see that the header was added, I figured it out by comparing against Fiddler.

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
Since Chrome applications will be deprecated in 2017, please give Windows and Mac users standalone apps too. The product is wonderful and I would hate to lose it!

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
REST API testing. It's super easy to keep track of your tests and also demo API usage to customers.

all_reviews.review_content:

Great user interface, keeps history, customizable, allows creation of a battery of tests.

What do you dislike about Postman?
Postman works only as a Google Chrome or Chromium extension. I would like to have it as a standalone application.

We are building RESTful APIs for healthcare using HL7 FHIR standard. We use Postman to test our APIs and to play with FHIR reference servers.

all_reviews.review_title: Postman review
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Postman?
It is a simple interface for testing APIs.

What do you dislike about Postman?
The interface runs on a web browser for Mac so when you toggle between windows, it cannot be accessed separately from a browser window. It is a native app, which is why it doesn't make sense  that you cannot make the distinction from say a chrome browser window and your postman instance

Recommendations to others considering Postman:
There are a few API clients which you can use, and based off of what I have seen, this is the easiest to use and understand.

What problems is Postman solving and how is that benefiting you?
API testing.
